A.response_text: CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Bones and sinew weave a shell as they are rebuilt from the life-fire of the Nether Edge. The light dims and Eidos feels that she now stands knee deep in water. Lowering her gaze, she finds that she is indeed standing upon a submerged Farcaster seal, however it looks as if a white marble fountain has been constructed around it.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0010!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Stepping from the watery seal, Eidos sits upon the marbled fountain and empties the intrusive water from her leg bindings. The cold yet gentle winds chill her soaked feet, causing her skin to tighten and her muscles to stiffen. Only after retying her bindings does she begin to truly examine her surroundings, a finely manicured Arboretum greeting her curious eyes. While there are rows of plants and the air is rich with the perfume of flowers, its appearance differs greatly from the garden of the Nether Edge. Its stately look, as if it has been fussed over a great deal, and lack of any sense of wildness stands in stark contrast to the Nether Edge.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0011!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: It looks as if there are two structures on opposing sides of the lengthy Arboretum. One looks humble and utilitarian, with a simple domed roof and narrow windows, a hundred paces or so to her left. The other is an opulent building, a residence perhaps, fifty paces to her right.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0012!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos soon observes that this surreal oasis of perfection stands amid the backdrop of craggy peaks to the west and a desert expanse extending indefinitely toward the east. A series of three aqueducts lead from the austere mountains down into the desert flats with one terminating right above the very Arboretum in which she stands. This one empties into a massive reservoir of pristine water. Several pipes seem to funnel the water off to parts unknown.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X901!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: And finally Eidos sees that she is not alone. Staring wide-eyed at her is a leathery crone, still as a statue. The old woman leans upon a wooden cane, its gnarls and knots mirroring her age-worn frame.\n\n\t\tWith a start, she shakes clear her self-imposed petrification, and with a surprising quickness in her step, scuttles briskly forward.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.903!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The elderly woman hobbles off towards the opulent residence. However, long before she arrives, the front door swings open, revealing what could only be the master of the house: a man dressed in fine, black silk and a feathered hat, his nose hawk-like, and protruding out over a mouth twisted in a perpetual scowl. His eyes are sharp and aware, not the eyes of a surprised man.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.9030!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Glowering at Rada as if reading her very soul, he executes a bizarre gesture of two fingers to his temple.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.9032!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The ancient matron whimpers soundlessly, as though forgetting how to properly squeal, and discomfort adds even more folds into her already generously creased brow. The man simply snarls, disgust tugging one side of his upper lip toward his beak. The other lines of his face seem to sketch out derisive dismissal and profound displeasure.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X9033!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Without warning, the click of the man's boots upon the stone floor cracks open the tense silence. He has renewed his advance towards Eidos, aquiline nose skyward, gait steady, exuding an unearned and unstable projection of confidence.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X905!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Khaa puts two fingers to his temple, causing an unraveling sense of awareness to well up within Eidos. She senses a Glyph being called to mind, but the moment lasts a mere fraction of a heartbeat.\n\n\t\tSuddenly, two individuals emerge from the trees, bearing spears and carrying faces devoid of emotion or expression. They move towards Eidos with a smooth and steady gait, their purpose clear. One among them makes a slow yet confident movement to grip Eidos' arm...

A.response_text: Comply

E.response_text: Attack

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!10.X000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Khaa leads Eidos to the center of the Arboretum, the simple fountain and its rippling surface covering the awaiting Farcaster seal. Here he gestures to the pool expectantly.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!10.X100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos steps into the fountain and walks atop the Farcaster.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!10.X101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: And bringing the Glyph to her thoughts, her Sigil resonates...

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!10.X102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Khaa turns on his heel and glides gracefully back into his abode, leaving Eidos standing before the Farcaster. She wonders whether to begin her journey in the Wellspring or to explore the township of Dazir.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the Dazir Arboretum near the marble fountain. A wind blows down from the craggy peaks and gently wends its way through the trees, temporarily disrupting their artificial perfection.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking at the circular platform, it seems to be carved of white marble, and is now recessed into the flagstone path of the Arboretum. From beneath emanates a violet haze, a glowing light of unknown origin. Nearby, is an elderly man, dozing away without a care in the world.

A.response_text: Step upon the floating platform

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos walks towards the low building. Upon closer scrutiny, it is wholly unlike the rest of the surroundings. The gargantuan bricks that of which it is built are a dark sandstone, clearly quarried from a different region than the marble decorating the Arboretum. These bricks have also been cut in a much more rudimentary and less fanciful design. However, their apparent simplicity is contrasted by their fine work as they were clearly shaped with cunning exactitude and assembled with impeccable precision.\n\n\t\tNear the gate stands a guard, boasting an expression of an all-consuming boredom etched upon his face, which he barely raises at her approach.

A.response_text: Approach the guard

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.004!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking around, Eidos sees Khaa's rather extravagant abode to the north, standing as the foreground to the cusp where the mountains meet the flats in the background. At the opposite side of the Arboretum stands the austere structure of the Daziran Archives, while further into the Arboretum is the circular stone platform.

A.response_text: Approach the Archives

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.X005!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Strolling in the direction of the guard to signal a desire for interaction, Eidos attempts to engage the man in conversation. Despite clearly having misanthropy as his tutor for social grace, he appears to at least be capable of simple conversation...

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.006!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The scintillating conversation at its terminus, Eidos thinks about how to proceed.

A.response_text: Speak to the guard again

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.X900!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos feels the chill waters of the fountain as she stands upon the Daziran Farcaster. Water yet dripping from her foot bindings, she casts her gaze about the Arboretum. Nearby, she observes the decadent home of the mage-leader Khaa with its curious backdrop of steep mountain crags meeting the empty desert flats. The humble - though masterfully masoned - Archives hold their ground to the south. And finally, the floating cloudstone lift and its unnecessary caretaker likewise remain where she left them. A place for everything and everything in its place.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!20.X000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos feels the chill waters of the fountain as she stands upon the Daziran Farcaster. Water yet dripping from her foot bindings, she casts her gaze about the Arboretum. As if transfixed, her eyes fall upon the decadent home of the mage-leader Khaa with its surreal backdrop of steep mountain crags meeting the empty desert flats.\n\n\t\tAn inescapable magnetism draws Eidos towards the mage's abode, the suspicions of who might have instigated the Wellspring fiasco acting as the north pole and her curiosity as the south. And so towards that opulent, shimmering building she ventures, in search of answers.

A.response_text: Enter Khaa's Abode

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0099.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: As her victim falls into the flowering shrubs of the Arboretum, Eidos now notices the mage of Dazir arriving on the scene. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!99.X00!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Reforming upon the surface of the Farcaster, a retinue guards immediately point their spears at Eidos, while one soldier summons Khaa. The mage is less than pleased with her arrival.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!99.01!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As Eidos begins to materialize, a brilliant and ghastly conflagration ignites within her gut, instantly incinerating her from inside out... Eidos is not welcome in Dazir, this much is as clear.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, a warmth uncharacteristic of this mountain township greets her. The stars stare down upon her, yet a soft amber light emanates from below. Save this highest tier, all of Dazir is engulfed in flames. Men, women and children are all being slaughtered by the Tacribian invaders; their screams play the music of this gruesome symphony.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: It is as though Eidos has walked into a waking nightmare.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos suddenly notices some... thing... standing right next to her. At first glance, the creature appears to be a human, but is decidedly something else entirely. The figure is dressed in dusty robes, patched and mended so many times that the original fabric is hard to discern. Yet every stitch of thread, each scrap of cloth is dyed some shade of red. It clutches in its grip a large wooden staff and hides its features behind a wide-brimmed hat, tinted in the hue of dried blood.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.X003!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: After uncounted breaths, the figure looks up, revealing the sly contours of its face. It speaks.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, a warmth uncharacteristic of this mountain township greets her. The stars stare down upon her, yet a soft amber light emanates from below. Save this highest tier, all of Dazir is engulfed in flames. Men, women and children are all being slaughtered by the Tacribian invaders; their screams play the music of this gruesome symphony.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: It is as though Eidos has walked into a waking nightmare.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos suddenly notices some... thing... standing right next to her. At first glance, the creature appears to be a human, but is decidedly something else entirely. The figure is dressed in dusty robes, patched and mended so many times that the original fabric is hard to discern. Yet every stitch of thread, each scrap of cloth is dyed some shade of red. It clutches in its grip a large wooden staff and hides its features behind a wide-brimmed hat, tinted in the hue of dried blood.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Surely as the sun rises in the east, a memory wells up within Eidos. Memories twisted and corrupted to the whims and will of this very creature, to Famlicus.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.X104!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: After uncounted breaths, he looks up, revealing the sly contours of his face, and a raspy voice pierces the shadows beneath his hat.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!101.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The air around Famlicus appears to distort, causing his form to scatter left and right layer-by-layer until there remains no trace of him.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!101.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The Tacribians now get their long-awaited vengeance on Dazir, ravaging the town and erasing all traces of the Daziran legacy as they purge. The tensions have been resolved with the snapping of the slender thread that precariously bound these townships for so long.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!101.002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Nothing will ever be the same. And yet Eidos somehow feels a detached calmness. Drawing upon the strength of her Trueflesh, she realizes that all is inconsequential. All is temporary. All is uncontrollable. All possibilities will manifest themselves within the fullness of time. But more than this...

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!101.003!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: All is, was and ever shall be as it should be.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!101.004!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Thus, Eidos feels her ghost gently drifting off into the sea of infinity. Floating on until she is no longer able to distinguish herself from the surrounding darkness of the endless Void. But even still, she knows there is something else, something beyond this.

A.response_text: Dream
DIP

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!990.00!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, a desolate silence uncharacteristic of this mountain township greets her. The stars stare down upon her, yet no lights from below illuminate the lower tiers. No signs of human habitation remain. No scents from cooking pots on the fire, no laughs from carefree children at play, not even the gentle croaking and chirping of night creatures can be heard in this utterly abandoned site.\n\n\t\tLooking about, Eidos notes that the Archives guard has abandoned his post and the old man by the lift has departed. The floating cloudstone itself lies irreparably fragmented into a thousand pieces at the bottom of the shaft, hundreds of spans below this garden tier.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!990.01!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos steps once more into the fragrant Arboretum, by default approaching the Farcaster seal, meanwhile pondering what next to do.

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.X000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.104!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.105!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!999.106!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.000!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Hmmmm? What is it you want, boy? Can't you see I'm resting!?"

A.response_text: "Could you tell me about Dazir?"

D.response_text: "Too senile to see that I am a woman, then?"

E.response_text: "You must be seeking eternal rest to speak to me so."

F.response_text: "It's unwise to sleep here; this here is gremlin country..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.100!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "If I have to explain Dazir to one more foreigner, I'll go as mad as an outhouse Jinn!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1000!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Fine! Now pick up your ears, boy; only gonna say this once!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1001!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Dazir isn't a flat township like the one those Tambulan bumpkins inhabit."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1005!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Oh, don't make an old man laugh himself to an early grave!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1007!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Shut up! I'm old, not senile, you jinnlickin' fool!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1008!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "So, as I was saying... We built our township vertically - a much better use of space, I'm sure you'll agree. And it gets us closer up the slope of Mount Kefkan towards the Wellspring!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1009!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "You can use this here cloudstone to go to the other levels."

A.response_text: "Could you tell me about these other levels."

E.response_text: "I don't take kindly to your derisive tone, old man."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2000!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Why it's a cloudstone, you jinnstruck, truth-blind nincompoop!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2001!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's sagging balls! Anymore inane questions and I'll go as mad as an outhouse Jinn!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2002!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Fine! Now pick up your ears boy; only gonna say this once!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2005!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "It's been awakened to life by the Technocraft of Daziran artisans and magi."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2006!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "We use 'em to great effect, lifting folk through the levels of Dazir without gears, winches or pulleys - not that those machines are beyond our ken of course, but I'm sure you'll agree this is more elegant!"

A.response_text: "What's on the other levels?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.400!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's sagging balls! How can I tell when you jinnstruck foreigners dress like that?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4000!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Don't you know what women's clothes look like, you illiterate plains-dweller!?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4001!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Take a look at the Artisan Plaza and get yourself something decent to wear!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4002!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "This cloudstone here will take you to where you need to go - and take you far away from me!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4003!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Quickly now! No need to stand in awe at our ability to manipulate the substance of matter itself - such wonders are commonplace in Dazir, boy!"

D.response_text: "What else could this power be used for?"

E.response_text: "What's more amazing is that anyone tolerates your continued existence."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.500!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "You think you scare me, Jinn's child?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5000!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Old Asansor has seen a great many muscle-bound fools thinking they could get the best of us Dazirans!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5001!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Right now, Khlutt and his Tacribian thugs - draug-brained nincompoops the lot of them - are thinking just that!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5002!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "But tell me, boy, what's going to happen when they see the likes of this cloudstone!?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5004!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "They'll have little more to do than fling their filth at it and walk home, tail between their legs! That's what!"

A.response_text: "I demand to know what else is in Dazir."

D.response_text: "Tell me more about the benefits of this power..."

E.response_text: "Your door means nothing; I command the Farcaster, fool."

F.response_text: "Gremlins, ancient one. Gremlins. The hoary enemies of Roostor!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.101!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Listen up, because old Asansor will only tell you one time and one time alone!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1010!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Because I never repeat myself, you hear?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1011!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "So listen up, because old Asansor will only tell you one time and one time alone!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1012!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "The lowest tier is for the rank and file Dazirans who do much of the unmasterful labors - may be simple and dull-witted compared to the upper tiers, but I doubt the best of what the other towns have to offer is their equal!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1013!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "The second tier is for the Artisans of Dazir! Those learned elite who're trained in unearthing and manipulating relics of the Vanquished."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1014!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Finally, there's the Arboretum where we stand, which is for Khaa, Quangjo and their trusted citizens alone!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1015!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "You aren't likely to find a man with as many years of experience and loyal service under his belt than old Asansor in the levels below!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.201!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Why we learned from Biracul, you truth-blind fool!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2010!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Aren't you ashamed of yourself for asking questions even a child could answer?! Though I guess anyone might seem truth-blind next to us Dazirans!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2011!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Look, why don't you go speak with the children of Dazir; they might offer a more equal level of intellect for you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.401!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "You mean other than allowing us to craft the greatest and strongest gateway in all of Kabu?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4010!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "If you need further proof, just look over at the Archives - time was that the entire building rested at the lowest level of Dazir, right next to the Temple to Biracul!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4011!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "But long ago, a great mage raised that entire structure up to this level!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4012!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Can't seem to recall which one, though..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.501!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Hey, now, boy... You ever notice how every once in a while, you run into someone you just shouldn't have angered?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!1.001!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "How'd you even get up here in the first place?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!1.X003!ASANSOR!.dialogue_text: "Now off with you, you jinnlickin' fool! I'm trying to sleep!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.000!FAMLICUS!.dialogue_text: "Care to look upon the carnage you've created, daughter of Viracocha?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.001!FAMLICUS!.dialogue_text: "Whether consciously or unconsciously, you seem to have looked favorably upon the Tacribians..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.002!FAMLICUS!.dialogue_text: "But, it's of no consequence to me which side lives... Either way, my goal is achieved."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.003!FAMLICUS!.dialogue_text: "And with yet another Great Awakening avoided, your role in my little play is over."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!100.004!FAMLICUS!.dialogue_text: "You are now free to do what you wish with what remains of your life, Eidos."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.000!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Sorry, the Archives are off limits until further notice."

A.response_text: "Can you make an exception in my case?"

D.response_text: "I was given express permission from Khaa to gain entry."

E.response_text: "It can be dangerous for a weakling to guard something all alone."

F.response_text: "Gremlin infestation, huh? When will it be 'on limits' again?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.100!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Of course! Right this way outsider! No laws of Dazir apply to you!"

A.response_text: "You have my gratitude!"

D.response_text: "Sarcasm, the lowest form of humor..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1000!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls, you foreigners are all alike!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1001!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "You all want a free pass; doubt you've had a real day's work in your life!

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1002!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "You probably spend all your time 'fishing' like our useless Librarian."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1003!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "But at least if that Jinn's dick were here, I wouldn't have to waste words with simpletons like you."

A.response_text: "Is that where he went?"

E.response_text: "How 'bout I cut your tongue out, so you never have to waste words again?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.200!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "It's common knowledge that Quangjo has left his post, and as there is no one able to perform a Librarian's duties, the Archives are closed."

A.response_text: "Where did he go?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.400!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "What, do I look like a Tacribian to you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4000!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Although only some illiterate outlander could think up that dumb a lie!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4001!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "So let me say this clearly, so even a lackwit like you can understand: No one is allowed means, 'NO ONE IS ALLOWED!' You get it?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4002!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Unless Khaa himself tells me you are allowed in, the best view of the Archives you'll get is from out here!"

D.response_text: "I am a friend to Khaa; he will be most displeased to hear of this."

E.response_text: "It's a shame Khaa isn't here; he may have stopped me from murdering you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.500!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Big words for such a little girl... though about as empty as your head, I'd wager."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5000!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "You see, I've got a whole township behind me. What have you got?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X5001!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Now are you going to leave or do you want to take on all of Dazir?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.600!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "...Uh, when Ark returns to slay the Gremlin king?"

F.response_text: "There's a new gremlin-slayer in town: me!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.101!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "You think that someone whose job involves standing around in one spot all day, would be up to date on people's whereabouts?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1010!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "You're dumber than you look! Might even be dumber than a Tacribian..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2010!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Look, Quangjo was recently reposted to the Wellspring. And after the... uh... incident... in the Wellspring, Quangjo returned alive, but jinnstruck."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2011!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "He had strange nightmares and would sleepwalk at night, they say. And then one morning, he was simply... gone."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X2012!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Now do us both a favor: make like Quangjo and disappear."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.401!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Khaa has many 'friends'... But believe me, if you were even remotely important to Khaa, I'd have known about you long before you got here - you're certainly no Mifas'cul, I'll tell you that much..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X601!KADIR!.dialogue_text: "Look, I don't know what Jinn crawled up your arse, but I'll be having no more of it!"

F.response_text: "So I'm hired? When do I start?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "If my aged assistant speaks accurately, you materialized in this place with the aid of the Farcaster. Now whether this is true or some kind of trick dreamed up by you and this senile old bag, I have yet to determine."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Who are you and where do you come from? Do not lie to me, outsider, or I will know."

A.response_text: "My name is Eidos. I awoke in a structure somewhere underground."

B.response_text: "I'm not certain who I am, nor where I come from."

D.response_text: "Indeed, using the Farcaster is but one of my powers..."

E.response_text: "I have no intention of answering your asinine questions."

F.response_text: "...Is that your hat, or did it come with the job?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "A structure? This land is dotted with caves, caverns and the like, but a structure could only be a ruin of the Vanquished, a place one such as you would have little reason to be."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.1000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Nor does this explain where you were before or how you used the Farcaster. Explain this to me. Now."

A.response_text: "There I met a wolf. He taught me how to use it."

B.response_text: "There's nothing else to tell, since I have no prior memory."

E.response_text: "You're too ignorant to be making presumptions about me."

F.response_text: "All I know is my past must have involved blunt force trauma to the head."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.200!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So you have spent your life as a drunkard, wandering here and there begging for your next sack of Jinn-Liquor?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.2000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Rada's mind must have decayed indeed to mistake your trespassing for some kind of miracle..."

A.response_text: "Look, I think I was only recently born."

B.response_text: "You misunderstand. I simply have no memories and seek answers."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.300!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Your attempts to shield your identity will not succeed. It is within my power to rip the answers I seek from your mind!"

B.response_text: "You misunderstand. I simply have no memories and seek answers."

C.response_text: "Nothing I've done or will do will be of any consequence."

D.response_text: "You just may discover that using the Farcaster is but one of my powers..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.400!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Oh? And how did you come by such knowledge? If you were a mage of this land, I would know it."

C.response_text: "I assure you that I'm no threat to you."

D.response_text: "I come from a distant land, and this power comes naturally to me."

E.response_text: "It's not in my interest to educate the ignorant."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.500!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Oh, you don't have to. Not when I can tear open the defenses of your weak mind and learn whatever I please!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.5000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I must warn you that you are hardly among friends now. Aside from respect one should show to one's host, it is dangerous to anger those who are so clearly your superiors, foreigner."

A.response_text: "All you would see is a deserted Sanctuary and a talking wolf."

D.response_text: "You may discover that using the Farcaster is but one of my powers..."

E.response_text: "You've earned neither my fear nor my respect."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.600!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So you have spent your life as a drunkard, wandering here and there begging for your next sack of Jinn-Liquor?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.6000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Rada's mind must have decayed indeed to mistake your trespassing for some kind of miracle."

A.response_text: "Look, I woke up in some building and learned a Glyph from a talking wolf."

B.response_text: "Look, brother, I have no memories. Can you help me find them?"

F.response_text: "...I'm sorry I wasn't paying attention."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X1010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But we shall see how deep your deceit runs..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.1011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "We shall see how deep your deceit runs..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.201!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Then you must be suffering from an ailment of the Trueflesh..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.2010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Given my wealth of experience in curing such ailments, I can undoubtedly guide you towards an appropriate course of action."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X2011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though you must first allow me to peer into your mind, so that I can determine how best to help you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.2012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though you must first allow me to peer into your mind, so that I can determine how best to help you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.301!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "And you expect me to take your word at this?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.3010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Let me tell you something, foreigner. A vagrant's word means nothing to me, least of all one whose mind-crystal is so clearly 'unilluminated'."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X3011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will peer into your mind and learn if you are a threat to us."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.3012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will peer into your mind and learn if you are a threat to us."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.401!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "If this is true, I must peer into your mind to determine the veracity of your claims."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X4010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Prepare yourself, outsider; I will not be gentle."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.4011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Prepare yourself, outsider; I will not be gentle."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.5010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I've lived too long to stand here and be insulted by a Rikharr-loving vagabond!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X5011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will tear open your mind and find what I need myself!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.5012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will tear open your mind and find what I need myself!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "How is it that you rebuff my Truesight?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7003!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It cannot be so... as you can use the Farcaster..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7004!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No... I recall, there was one, long ago, who sought to deaden the mind with unholy Techne."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7005!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "He was cast into the Waste and his madness ended there."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7006!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Fitting, I think, that you will join him in the House of Dust..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.700!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I can see your travels through Kabu..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X701!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You have not ranged so far as the canyon realm of our enemies..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "What were you doing among those Tacribian apes?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X702!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I see, you spoke with their barbarous leader..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yet you agreed to nothing, all to the good..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.703!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Why... You dare collude with Khlutt's against us!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I have seen all I need to."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You are a threat that I will not allow to live."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X710!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...you do not seem to have colluded with the denizens of Tambul..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.711!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...you appear to have paid a visit to our 'friends' in Tambul. Interesting..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.712!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...you traded words with that Jinn in human skin, Pakahron... but had no ears for his lies."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X7120!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "How unexpectedly wise, for one so uncivilized..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.713!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As expected of a truth-blind foreigner... yet harmless to us none the less."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X7200!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...the deserted remains of Old Tacriba, likely..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.722!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...Facing a Neverborn sentry... progress thwarted... but ultimately you prevailed..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.X730!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...Ah! Now I see! You stood on a Farcaster seal! So that's how you came to be here..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7300!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Then all that remains is to extract the memory of where you stole its lost Glyph..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.731!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "...You wandered the halls and corridors of a Vanquished ruin... Old Tacriba, likely..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.7310!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You encountered a great power bearing the mark of the Emerald Architect... an ill omen... it joined its cause to your own..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.740!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But wait... Ah! Now I see! You stood on a Farcaster seal! So that's how you came to be here..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.741!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Then all that remains is to extract the memory of where you stole its lost Glyph..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.742!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Earlier still, you awoke in the shadows... you speak, yet I see no interlocutor... all alone."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.743!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "What madness is it that grips you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.751!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I've looked back across the span of your life, but before your travels in our land, I see nothing."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!00.752!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Curious... It seems you truly are a woman with no past."

A.response_text: DIP

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You strike me as a person concerned with the well-being of others... Do I misjudge you, or would you be interested in an undertaking that would preserve the lives of my people?"

A.response_text: "What is it that threatens this place and its people?"

B.response_text: "I'm more concerned with truth and understanding."

E.response_text: "I'm listening."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.200!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No doubt an inquisitive individual such as yourself is interested in learning and understanding... We Dazirans can be of assistance to you in this matter."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, this is only if you can complete a simple task that will ensure the survival of my people."

A.response_text: "What is it that threatens this place and its people?"

B.response_text: "How can you help me learn what I wish to know?"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.300!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I can see how hard you try to walk a noncommittal path. That road has come to an end for you, I'm afraid."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "For you see, a great disaster looms, and those who do nothing to thwart genocide, are only aiding its cause!"

B.response_text: "Your problems are your own; I only wish to learn and understand."

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "Who would be so cruel to do such a thing!?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.400!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You are a crafty one - or at least, you aim to be..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yet you have not mastered your mental defenses, thereby allowing others to unweave the threads of your memories with the greatest of ease."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're most fortunate indeed that we currently have a use for you!"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "Who would be so brazen to stand against you..?"

E.response_text: "Stop wasting my time and get to the point."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.500!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Despite facing beings that could tear your mind to shreds, you still feel no fear."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Dazir could use someone with your talents."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Our foes are ruthless, and I mean to respond in kind!"

A.response_text: "Why have you made such dangerous enemies?"

D.response_text: "Who would be so brazen to stand against you!?"

E.response_text: "Stop wasting my time and get to the point!"

F.response_text: "Delectable? Lubricated? Thoughty?"
"'As odd as you are ugly!' I always like to say."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes... well, I imagine you would welcome a chance to prove your mettle as a true hero, isn't that right Mistress... Gremlinsbane?"

F.response_text: "Indeed, I come to rid the land of the gremlin menace!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.101!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Dazir is menaced by the people of Tacriba, the township of barbarians located beyond the Crescent Canyon to the east."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Since the time of Ark, they have always made their way in the world with the violence of the Amethyst Jinn; even as we speak, they are preparing to march on our magnificent settlement."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "All that stands between them and us are two Vanquished gates - mighty obstacles indeed, but I would prefer a more... permanent solution."

A.response_text: "For what reason would they do this?"

E.response_text: "Why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.201!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're fortunate indeed to find yourself in Dazir! For we are the most learned and skillful of the peoples of Kabu."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Alas, the backwards tribe of Tacriba means to destroy us. And if they succeed, all of our priceless knowledge will be lost!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Help us and our centuries of learning will be yours!"

A.response_text: "Why would Tacriba do this?"

B.response_text: "What kind of knowledge does Dazir possess?"

C.response_text: "I'm an outlander; this feud doesn't interest me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As the Tacribian tribe seeks to dominate this region, their folly concerns the actions of all people of Kabu, as well as those 'in' Kabu."

B.response_text: "What kind of knowledge does your civilization possess?"

C.response_text: "I'm an outlander; this feud doesn't interest me."

D.response_text: "Why is your survival at stake?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.401!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Khlutt, the brutish leader of the Tacribian tribe, that's who!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "That truth-blind Famlazlover covets control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us at the moment, Tacriba is no doubt seeking a way to circumvent this obstacle."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "We have secured the base of the aqueduct leading to the Dawn Fortress with a contingent of crystal experts ready to demolish it, should they attempt to pass the canyon using the aqueduct."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4013!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But Khlutt is as crafty as he is pernicious... It's only a matter of time before he finds a way across to massacre every living being on this side of the canyon!"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "What interest does this barbarian have with your Wellspring..?"

E.response_text: "And why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.501!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You see, the uncultured Tacribians covet control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us at the moment, Khlutt is no doubt seeking a way to circumvent this obstacle."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "We have secured the base of the aqueduct leading to the Dawn Fortress with a contingent of crystal experts ready to demolish it, should they attempt to pass the canyon using the aqueduct."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But Khlutt is as crafty as he is pernicious... It's only a matter of time before he finds a way across to massacre every living being on this side of the canyon!"

A.response_text: "And what did you do to spark his ire?"

D.response_text: "What power do you possess that the Tacribians covet!?"

E.response_text: "And why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.601!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes, well you see, the Tacribian... gremlin-men... covet control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "And their gremlin-mage is a vile abomination named Khlutt."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While currently the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us, Khlutt is surely scheming a way to circumvent this obstacle."

F.response_text: "Strange... Why covet water when Gremlins spurn baths and cleanliness..?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.102!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Well, you understand, our ancient Wellspring is not merely a holy site!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "In fact, it serves as a reservoir, sustaining all the townships of this land."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, through no fault of our own, the Wellspring has become defiled..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1022!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Creatures now stalk its halls, water has ceased to flow to Tacriba, and the entrance has been sealed, leaving the Farcaster inside as the only point of access..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1024!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "The Farcaster Glyph has been lost since the Punishing Wars devastated Kabu a thousand some ought years ago. No records of its use or even any mention of its existence remain, save the seals themselves..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1025!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yet a Farcaster user now stands before me - a gift from Biracul, no doubt."

A.response_text: "The Tacribians sound justified in their grievance."

E.response_text: "Perhaps I should help your enemies; they, at least, sound competent."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.202!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It is the sacred charge of Dazir to be the custodians of the ruins left behind by the ancient Vanquished, the greatest among them being a Wellspring dedicated to the Water Spirits."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But now, the ancient site has sealed its entrance to us and the only way to access it is through the use of a Farcaster."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Your task would be to enter and cleanse this ancient ruin of the evil that haunts it - once completed, our ancient Archives would be entirely at your disposal, of course."

A.response_text: "I still don't understand why Tacriba would do this."

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.302!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I imagine even you would be interested in the possibility of a death of thirst..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, the Tacribians seek to claim the Wellspring for themselves, knowing nothing of its operation!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Their betrayal of Biracul's order threatens the lives of all civilized folk in Kabu... including yourself."

B.response_text: "What would you want me to do?"

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

D.response_text: "If you were to share your knowledge, I might be able to help you..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.402!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "By being the guardians of ancient Vanquished ruins, we have learned much about the manipulation of the physical world; and the Tacribians have always been envious of us and our mastery."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, they seek to claim the Wellspring for themselves, knowing nothing of its operation!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Clearly, their betrayal of Biracul's order threatens the lives of all civilized folk in Kabu."

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

D.response_text: "If you were to share your knowledge, I might be able to help you..."

E.response_text: "I admire ambition. Why should I not help your enemies?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As you may have ascertained, this war will decide the balance of power in the region."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Ally with us now, and you will have the gratitude of the future masters of Kabu!"

A.response_text: "What would you need me to do?"

D.response_text: "I'd be far more capable of success if you'd kindly provide me with some boon..."

E.response_text: "Only if you're victorious. Why shouldn't I just help your enemies?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, I should mention that the ancient Wellspring we maintain is not merely for water; in fact it contains many holy relics of the ancient Vanquished from before the Great Awakening."

F.response_text: "So, that's their game."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.103!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "They are, perhaps, but their thirst for violent reprisal will doom us all."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "If they succeed in their assault, then none will remain with knowledge of how to maintain the Wellspring or its aqueducts."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Our destruction would seal the fate of all who dwell in Kabu, Dazirans and Tacribians alike."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, I implore you: use your Farcasting ability to help me to save both ourselves and our enemies!"

A.response_text: "I'll help you avert this catastrophe."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

E.response_text: "I need something more than promises for such an undertaking."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1033!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes, of course, allow me to explain. You see, the Wellspring is not merely a holy site; it also supplies water to the other townships."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1034!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, something has happened to disrupt the flow of water, sparking the ire of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1035!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As you are possibly the only living Farcaster user, you alone can enter the Wellspring's halls, cleanse the corruption and restore the passage of water to the Tacribian township."

A.response_text: "I'll help you avert this catastrophe."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

E.response_text: "Not at this time."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.203!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "The answer to this mystery has eluded us..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps an evil spirit awoke within, or perhaps a Tacribian saboteur engineered this incident to give a cause for their invasion - fools that they are by barring all from entry with their unbridled stupidity!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "What is certain, is that with the water flow restored, those boorish savages will have no reason to be as angry as the Amethyst Jinn any longer."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So I ask: will you help us to restore the water and avert a catastrophe?"

A.response_text: "I wish to see this Wellspring for myself; I accept your task."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.303!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now is the only time you have!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "My people don't have the luxury to wait for your 'ifs' or 'whethers'! We need your ability to Farcast immediately because our destruction is imminent!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.3031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Note that I will take any further delay as a refusal; so decide now what your course of action will be!"

D.response_text: "Then I accept, gracious Khaa."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I see that you mean to worm whatever secrets you can from me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But I suppose that makes you are a fitting weapon to use against my foes."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Very well, I shall grant you access to my township; whatever knowledge you find from my people is yours."

C.response_text: "I don't think this will be enough."

D.response_text: "Then I accept, gracious Khaa."

E.response_text: "I'll do it, but with such a humble boon I can promise little..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.503!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You are brave to act so boldly towards a mage in his own home... or perhaps merely truth-blind."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will assume the latter, and forgive your misspeech this time."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now listen carefully, Dazir is the sole inheritor of the relics left by the Vanquished. If the Tacribians succeed in destroying us, you will never learn the secrets of our untold power!"

A.response_text: "Then I accept."

D.response_text: "Share some of this power with me and I can save your people."

E.response_text: "Why beg me for help if you are so powerful? Your lies sicken me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.603!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes! And the only way to stop the gremlin-men is to send the water back to the Dawn Fortress..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So do you accept this quest? Will you use your unique ability to Farcast? Will you save our realm from the Gremlin Menace?!"

D.response_text: "Give me your hat and I'll think about it."

E.response_text: "Of course not! I'll deal with the gremlins my way!"

F.response_text: "Fear not, sweet Khaa; good will prevail!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.104!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "That you seek to righteously preserve innocent lives speaks very highly of your character, Eidos!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now listen closely for here is what you must do."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You will use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at the heart of which you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Open it and you will have our eternal gratitude."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.1043!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Ah! But in order to manipulate the guardians within, as well as all other mechanisms, you'll likewise require this Sigil of Wulfias."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.204!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Only a true lover of wisdom could recognize the folly of those draug-witted Tacribians!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Together we can defend the sanctity of knowledge, but first listen to what you must do."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You'll use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at the heart of which you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and our Archives will teach you many secrets of the hoary Vanquished!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2043!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, in order to do so, you'll likewise require this Sigil of Wulfias; together they will enable you to control all mechanisms within the Temple."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "My people do not have the luxury of waiting for you to master a lifetime of lore and knowledge!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But if you are so fearful, you may briefly speak with the learned folk of Dazir; their knowledge will help you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.2047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though you are not to tarry long! Time is of the essence!"

A.response_text: "I'll go to the Wellspring without delay."

C.response_text: "I think I'll pass and just leave."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.404!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You have chosen wisely... Now pay close attention!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I will give you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're as guileful as the Ruby Jinn himself..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4045!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though I should hardly expect more from a desert vagabond."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Very well, then you may briefly speak with the learned denizens of Dazir to help you prepare."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But first, pay close attention, to what I am about to say."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4048!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.4049!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I will give you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.40490!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I shall gift you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.5048!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

F.response_text: "Sure thing, honey buns."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Also, take the Sigil of Wulfias to control the..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Well, you'll probably just destroy the crystal controlling the dam anyway... but just in case."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.6044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No, but you may wander Dazir and help yourself to any hats you find lying around."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.7000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While this Sigil will put much of the Wellspring at your command, it will wear upon your untrained mind..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.X7001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You must make haste in your mission before the heathen Trueflesh of Wulfias does you harm!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.7003!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Return to me once you have freed the water and I'll alleviate your mind from the inimical effects of the Heathen's poisonous touch."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!9.001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will not allow someone so clearly hostile to our lives to remain here a moment longer!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!9.002!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You will be escorted out of Dazir immediately."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!10.X003!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now use it and travel to the Wellspring; restore the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress, that we might end these deadly hostilities!"

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.0000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now use it and travel to the Wellspring; restore the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress, that we might end these deadly hostilities!"

A.response_text: _Use the Sigil of Farcasting_

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!11.001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Fine. But be quick, as time grows short for us all."

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.000!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Biracul be praised! Where did you come from?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARBORETUM!0.0000!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Stay right there while I go find Khaa!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.X000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a space of a decisively religious quality. Though this place is clearly no temple, it has a preternatural and deific atmosphere. Perhaps it is the crystals casting a warm, filtered light, selectively illuminating unused desks and tomes; or perhaps it is the absence of humanity and the solitude of silence. Maybe it is the curious juxtaposition of overflowing knowledge with a dearth of learners.\tWhatever the case may be, this is a sanctum from the outside world. It is the outside world. A microcosm of the universe across time, compressed into single space. Simply here, frozen still, as it continually flows. Created just for her singular contemplation.

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.0000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Continuing her advance into the sanctum, Eidos observes the surroundings. The most stunning feature of this space is also the most dominant: a gargantuan tree, of ivory white, with an infinity of branches reaching high into the air and sprouting countless shining silvered leaves. Its roots are perfectly concealed beneath the tiled floors, with mere hints of them penetrating at regular intervals.\n\n\t\tCrystalline protrusions peek through cracks in the pale bark, bizarre emanations of energistic waves pouring forth from them. At first these peculiar growths look to be splitting the wood with their angular mineral geometry. However, upon further scrutiny Eidos notes that a sparkling sap surrounds these protrusions, giving the impression that the crystals are in fact the congealed lifeblood of the plant's structure.

A.response_text: Exit the Archives

B.response_text: Enter into communion with the tree

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos shuffles forth and places her palm upon one of the bulbous protrusions, immediately feeling the presence of a deep intellect. Speaking with a wordless voice, Eidos is drawn into communion with the mind of the tree. The whisper seems unintelligible to her linguistic call, though its voice seems strikingly familiar. As if picking up a conversation with an old friend, new memories begin to blossom within her mind. The tree weaves tales of ancient travelers, myths of proto-societies and many other stories, passionately told and devoutly remembered.

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.101!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The Muninn Tree, having selflessly imparted its knowledge unto Eidos, has nothing left to give.

A.response_text: Exit the Archives

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.X200!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
The entire archive seems carefully constructed to contain the tree's massive shape. The dimensions seem insufficient to allow further growth and most of the illumination seems to emanate from the subtly swaying leaves, blown by a wind only they sense.

		Walking around the perimeter reveals the austere, dark stone to be mostly unadorned but for a fresco at the side opposite the entrance. The painting looks to be a representation of the tree itself, though there are a number of notable discrepancies. While the leaves that hang from the branches above her are a pale silver, this tress seems to be in a full, green, springtime bloom. A yellow sun shines down from on high and a black bird is nestled among the boughs.

		Drawn over the tree are a series of circles in which many and varied shapes abide. They appear to have the look of Glyphs, though their function in this work is merely aesthetic, apparently conveying neither meaning nor power.

A.response_text: Exit the Archives

B.response_text: Enter into communion with the tree

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.200!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
The entire archive seems carefully constructed to contain the tree's massive shape. The dimensions seem insufficient to allow further growth and most of the illumination seems to emanate from the subtly swaying leaves, blown by a wind only they sense.

		Walking around the perimeter reveals the austere, dark stone to be mostly unadorned but for a fresco at the side opposite the entrance. The painting looks much the same as the one she viewed in the Tambulan Archive, what feels like lifetimes ago. However, there are a number of notable discrepancies. While the leaves that hung from the branches in the Tambulan image were crimson, these are a full, green, springtime bloom. A white halo as a brilliant yellow sun, shines down from on high. The two crows from the other township are absent, replaced by but a single black bird, nestled among the boughs.

		Drawn over the tree are a series of circles in which many and varied shapes abide. They appear to have the look of Glyphs, though their function in this work is merely aesthetic, apparently conveying neither meaning nor power.

A.response_text: Exit the Archives

B.response_text: Enter into communion with the tree

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.X900!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The door creaks as it opens, leading in to the crystal-lit Archives. An impossible feeling of familiarity. An ineffable connection to this scene. Though she has never been here before, Eidos remembers it. Perhaps the world may not remember, yet the knowledge of the Muninn Tree has not forgotten. The Interstice records all possible paths taken, giving each weight and significance. The knowledge now within her, assimilated to the will of one, now remembers its origins. It traces its leaves back to its branches, its trunk to its roots, its roots to its seed. And in so doing, it transcends.\n\n\t\tKnowledge is not powerful because of its origins, but rather because of its intrinsic truth. Though the fool may stumble upon the same truths as the wiseman, they would be no less authentic in essence.

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.900!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: And as so often happens when remembering, new connections are made and new puzzles solved. The result for Eidos is the recollection of a tome contained deep within the Interstice, pulled from it at the Muninn's behest. It speaks of a Wayfarer's adventures.\n\n\t\tAnd with that...

KABU!DAZIR!ARCHIVES!0.901!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Though perhaps upsetting, nothing remains here for Eidos. Nothing at all.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Walking beside the waist-high walls of this central level, Eidos leaves the plaza and reaches a residential district. Tiered buildings of carefully stuccoed adobe bricks face out toward an ambivalent desert. The level itself looms over the lowest area of the township, but rests under the watchful gaze of Khaa's garden and the menacing mountains beyond. Looking down, this vantage point offers an unobstructed view of the imposing gates, the majestic temple and the wretched slums of the lowest level.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X0000!DES.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the denizens, Eidos witnesses a number of people transiting through here, all dressed in varying shades of turquoise. Several among them seem to be engaged in lively debate regarding crystals or Vanquished mechanisms. Near the walls, a contingent of particularly mischievous children throwing rocks down into the slums are summarily punished by a group of frowning adults.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.0001!DESC.dialogue_text: Then inspecting the residences themselves, Eidos notes the finely painted mosaics adorning the entrances. Soft colors and frivolous themes give the area a sense of tranquility. Further enhancing this relaxed atmosphere are the cushioned benches lining the walls, shaded by blooming decorative trees. Masterfully sculpted fountains sit outside each door providing a continual flow of fresh water. Thirsty passersby stop to fill ornate flasks and then drink deeply under the scorching desert sun.

A.response_text: Return to the Artisans' Plaza
CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X0011!DES.dialogue_text: Walking about this residential area, the folk here seem either idle and taskless, or engaged in deep discussions. Those that do meet Eidos' gaze do so with an disapproving sneer before briskly strolling away. The more friendly minority shoot her a nod and a smile.

A.response_text: A balding man in a turquoise robe

B.response_text: The young girl reading a book

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X0022!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos sees that while there are still a few people with whom she may converse, Sidika is notably absent from the bench on which she once sat to read.

A.response_text: A balding man in a turquoise robe

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X002!DESC.dialogue_text: Gazing upon the decorative greenery, Eidos smells air perfumed by the scent of a hundred finely cultivated flowers. The desert heat seems held at bay by a fine mist, subtly pouring from pipes cleverly concealed within the fine stonework.\n\n\t\tWhile there are several folk who seem approachable, there is little else to do in this area of residence.

A.response_text: Exit to the Artisans' Plaza

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X003!DESC.dialogue_text: Abruptly, Sidika rises from the shade of the overhanging trees and rushes off. She does not look back at Eidos as she makes her first step towards her uncertain future.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.004!DESCR.dialogue_text: Gazing upon the decorative greenery, Eidos smells air perfumed by the scent of a hundred finely cultivated flowers. The desert heat seems held at bay by a fine mist, subtly pouring from pipes cleverly concealed within the fine stonework.\n\n\t\tWhile there are several folk who seem approachable, there is little else to do in this area of residence.

A.response_text: Exit to the Artisans' Plaza

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0099.000!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls to the fine tiles of the Mansion floor, shouts from the Plaza outside herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.X000!DE.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.001!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.100!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.101!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.102!DES.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.103!DES.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.104!DES.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.105!DES.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!999.106!DES.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.000!EGIME.dialogue_text: "What brings you to Dazir, foreigner? Seeking to escape the savage Tacribians in the east, or the monstrous draugnir beyond?"

A.response_text: "I come to render what aid I can to others."

B.response_text: "I know little of either; tell me more of these dangers."

C.response_text: "I don't yet know my course; I'm searching for it."

D.response_text: "Which is the greater threat?"

E.response_text: "I run from nothing."

F.response_text: "To spread the gospel of Roostor, good sir."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.100!EGIME.dialogue_text: "A noble aspiration, though I fear a tad presumptuous."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "Really, there is nothing you can do about the impending invasion. The Tacribians will spill our blood and that will be that."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1001!EGIM.dialogue_text: "A pity that we trusted them to defend us from the draugnir of the Wasteland, and now they betray that trust."

A.response_text: "Why do they seek to destroy you now?"

B.response_text: "What causes these draugnir to be such a threat?"

E.response_text: "Perhaps you know much about these Tacribians, but you know nothing of me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.200!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Indeed, they're connected. At the founding of the townships, the Tacribians were merely miners and scouts."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "But the draugnir began to emerge from the wastes and menace the townships. All agreed that the Tacribians were the most suited to destroying these monsters and thus, they began adopting a more militaristic way of life."

A.response_text: "Why do they seek to destroy you now?"

B.response_text: "What caused the draugnir to become such a threat?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.300!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Then you come soul-searching among the condemned, as the Tacribians will soon arrive and they come with a fire only our blood will extinguish."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "Still, they're not likely to harm an inoffensive outsider. So the draugnir are what you would need to concern yourself with."

B.response_text: "What caused the draugnir to become such a threat?"

D.response_text: "Tell me more about these draugnir!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.400!EGIME.dialogue_text: "For us, the Tacribians. They've always been jealous of us and now they're finally moving to destroy our peerless civilization."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "But they'd bear a harmless outsider such as you no ill will. To a wanderer, the draugnir are a greater danger."

D.response_text: "What of these draugnir?"

E.response_text: "Perhaps you know much about these beings, but you know nothing of me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.500!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Then you're either a powerful woman or a truth-blind fool."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "Things roam the wildlands that no sane person would face, such as the draugnir or worse..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5002!EGIM.dialogue_text: "Mortals cannot fight immortal evils, foreigner; and one's life is a dear price to pay for such short-lived vanity."

A.response_text: "Was Daziran vanity the cause of Tacriba's anger?"

D.response_text: "What of these creatures?"

E.response_text: "Truly many dangerous 'things' are from the desert; one even stands before you now."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.600!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Oh. So you're like that jinnstruck 'prophet'? All bandaged up and uttering nonsense."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.6000!EGIM.dialogue_text: "How is it that people believe such an obvious charlatan?!"

F.response_text: "Bandaged? Was he fighting gremlins or something?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.101!EGIME.dialogue_text: "It's trivial, really. You see, they blame us for the aqueduct malfunction."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1010!EGIM.dialogue_text: "A pity that they seal their own fate by destroying the only people that stand a chance at resolving their problem."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1011!EGIM.dialogue_text: "But then again, try as we might, none can bring sight to the truth-blind."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1012!EGIM.dialogue_text: "In any event, I think you should get on your way now, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X1013!EGI.dialogue_text: "Careful not to stay here too long, lest you get caught up in the bloodshed."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2010!EGIM.dialogue_text: "The Wasteland wears at your sanity and morality."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2011!EGIM.dialogue_text: "One of the reasons the Tacribians are such draug-brains is because of their proximity to the Wasteland - been completely robbed of humanity, I'd say."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.301!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Indeed, that's all one can do: to be mindful..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.401!EGIME.dialogue_text: "They're corrupted exiles that re-emerge from the Wasteland, no longer remembering their lives, only seeking to terrorize and consume the living."
