KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4010!EGIM.dialogue_text: "What's more is that their minds cannot be touched by those of the magi, like the branded Unseen - only cure for the draugnir is the destruction of their Falseflesh."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5010!EGIM.dialogue_text: "If you were truly kin to death, you'd have killed me already."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5011!EGIM.dialogue_text: "And if you were truly a servant of the Ruby Jinn, you wouldn't be announcing yourself as a threat."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5012!EGIM.dialogue_text: "Only a frightened dog barks as you do, really."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5013!EGIM.dialogue_text: "A powerful woman lets her actions speak for her... Would one so powerful waste words on vainglorious boasting?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.601!EGIME.dialogue_text: "Gremlins? By Biracul's beard, you're even worse than he was!"

A.response_text: "Gin? So you have a drinking problem then?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.000!KORAY.dialogue_text: "Have you encountered the wandering one many are calling the Prophet? His predictions seem to be gaining acceptance here in Kabu."

A.response_text: "Why do you think people believe him?"

B.response_text: "How is it that a simple man could know the future?"

D.response_text: "What do you think of him?"

E.response_text: "People are fools. What else do you expect?"

F.response_text: "My future is clear without prophets; gremlin-killin' is the life for me."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.100!KORAY.dialogue_text: "His predictions seem extremely incoherent... talking about the creation of shining crystal cities, plagues and pestilence, demons consuming the souls of the innocent, wars fought with weapons and beasts more fantastic than the oldest jinnlore."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1000!KORA.dialogue_text: "I think that his popularity stems from the fact that he offers a distraction from our recent hardships."

A.response_text: "It must be more than entertainment if he can resonate with the people."

B.response_text: "Why can he have this affect? Pure speechcraft?"

E.response_text: "I'd say you're just fools duped by an obvious fraud."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.200!KORAY.dialogue_text: "In truth, I doubt a simple man could."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2000!KORA.dialogue_text: "But he is a wanderer - like Torma. So perhaps he learned these fanciful stories in other lands..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2001!KORA.dialogue_text: "Or perhaps his journeys took him into the Wasteland..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2002!KORA.dialogue_text: "You know, it's said that men go mad in that place - even magi and crystals are said to lose their influence there."

A.response_text: "How could the ravings of a madman strike a chord with the people?"

B.response_text: "How is it that the Wasteland has such an effect?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.300!KORAY.dialogue_text: "He never ceases his wanderings and has spread his predictions to folk of all contingents - in that bizarre raspy voice of his."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3000!KORA.dialogue_text: "You know, some even say he crosses the desert and the Wasteland at will; been all over the world, they say."

B.response_text: "What does that have to do with his predictions?"

D.response_text: "But could he have survived the journey?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.400!KORAY.dialogue_text: "He never ceases his wanderings and has spread his predictions to folk of all contingents - in that bizarre raspy voice of his."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4000!KORA.dialogue_text: "You know, some even say he crosses the desert and the Wasteland at will; been all over the world, they say."

D.response_text: "But could he have survived the journey?"

E.response_text: "So the 'educated' citizens of Dazir believe in fairy tales, do they?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.500!KORAY.dialogue_text: "If it were merely the simpletons of Tambul or the boors of Tacriba I would agree with you, foreigner. However, even learned Dazirans have fallen under his sway."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5000!KORA.dialogue_text: "There are those that claim he even has followers beyond the Wasteland..."

A.response_text: "Why do some of your people believe in him?"

D.response_text: "I'm told none can survive the Wasteland..."

E.response_text: "Fools are rarely aware their fallacies: it's against your nature."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.6000!KORA.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls, you sound a bit jinntouched yourself; been out wandering the Wasteland lately, have you?"

F.response_text: "Jinntouched? Sounds like someone had a traumatizing childhood..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.101!KORAY.dialogue_text: "I wonder if the Prophet reflects the spirit of our age: the old covenants are broken and friends become foes; things fall apart; the pattern of our life is ended."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1010!KORA.dialogue_text: "A world without meaning, one where life can be exchanged for death without the notice or care of the gods..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1012!KORA.dialogue_text: "Yes, I think it may just be."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.201!KORAY.dialogue_text: "Well, for one, the landscape of the Wasteland is said to be littered with nullstone, a crystal with a poisonous effect on the brain."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2010!KORA.dialogue_text: "It's possible his exposure to this causes him to spread this affliction to others somehow?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2011!KORA.dialogue_text: "But that raspy voice sure is haunting, though..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.301!KORAY.dialogue_text: "If you have nothing to contribute, then I'll waste no more words on you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3010!KORA.dialogue_text: "I look not for pupils to lecture, but for partners to discuss."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.401!KORAY.dialogue_text: "There are some individuals, even in living memory, that have traversed the Wasteland and lived to tell about it."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4010!KORA.dialogue_text: "One was a mage from a distant land - Ormenos, if memory serves - who came to live among us for a time."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4011!KORA.dialogue_text: "Yet another was the Tacribian hermit who now lives in the canyon beyond Tambul."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X4012!KOR.dialogue_text: "Neither of their tales have good endings, so you'd do well not to walk the paths they forged..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.501!KORAY.dialogue_text: "You mock me, yet have nothing to offer other than your truth-blind insults!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.601!KORAY.dialogue_text: "I'm going to make a prediction of my own: You will one day cross the wrong individual and your madness, along with your life, will be brought to an end."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X6010!KOR.dialogue_text: "Biracul keep you from the Jinn's embrace."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.000!KORAY.dialogue_text: "Listen all! Heed the words of the Prophet! The Biraculian era and the Jinns will be relics of the past. Prepare yourselves for the awakening of Conscientia!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.000!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Hello there! Who are you? What brings you to Dazir? How old are you? You're pretty! Let's be friends!"

A.response_text: "I'm wandering this land to learn about its people."

B.response_text: "I too have many questions and am in search of answers."

C.response_text: "I'm no one of consequence, little girl."

D.response_text: "Who wants to know?"

E.response_text: "Be careful about asking questions; you might not like the answers."

F.response_text: "Stalphos Gremlinsbane at your service, young one!"

A.response_text: "Nice to meet you, Sidika; I am Eidos."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1003!SIDI.dialogue_text: "So are you a wanderer like Torma? Where have you been? Tambul? The Dawn Fortress? The Wasteland? Or have you even traveled beyond Kabu!?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1004!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I've heard of places beyond the desert that no one has seen since the times of the Vanquished!"

A.response_text: "Not nearly so far as those places yet! But who is this Torma?"

B.response_text: "Maybe, I'm not sure. Tell me more of these far off places."

E.response_text: "Where I have been doesn't concern a snot-nosed brat."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Well, Eidos,  my father's an artisan, so he's always looking for answers, too. But he looks for them only in books."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Books are great and all, but I still think the best way to learn is to travel, like you and Torma the Wayfarer!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2003!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Biracul's bells! I'm excited just thinking about it!"

A.response_text: "Who is this Torma character? Sounds like an interesting figure..."

B.response_text: "What do you know of other lands?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3000!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Only the bravest and most interestingest people travel the earth!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "The Wayfarer was the most exciting traveler ever!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.3002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "But she wasn't secretive like you, lady. She wrote down all her adventures - or his, I'm not sure if she's a boy or girl."

B.response_text: "What do you know of other lands?"

D.response_text: "And you trust these stories? Ha!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4000!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I suppose you have to be, what with facing so many dangers."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "But the Wayfarer wasn't mysterious: Torma always wrote down stories of where she'd been - or he, I'm not sure if she's a boy or girl."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "But anyway, I've always wanted to travel like her, ever since I was a little kid!"

D.response_text: "And you trust these stories? Ha!"

E.response_text: "Those so free with their tongues are fools or liars."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.500!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Yeesh! Are you scared of your own shadow, lady?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5000!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I'm not just any child you know; I'm an artisan's daughter and I know how to read!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I've also heard a lot about the outside world from Torma's books!"

A.response_text: "Who is this Torma?"

D.response_text: "And you trust these stories? Ha!"

E.response_text: "You know nothing until you've seen it for yourself, fool child."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.6001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Torma once wrote about a Gremlin King hiding in the Shadow Realm at the border of the Graylands..."

A.response_text: "Torma? Is that like a disease or something?"

B.response_text: "You sure know a lot about geography, kid! What other lands do you know of?"

F.response_text: "Gremlin King?! Then, its influence has spread this far?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1011!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Torma dug up the bones of Gurgadon!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1012!SIDI.dialogue_text: "She found the true battlefield of the Vedt!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1013!SIDI.dialogue_text: "She also located the hidden city of Ur'Ruk in the Wasteland!"

A.response_text: "Wow!"

E.response_text: "Okay, I get it..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1014!SIDI.dialogue_text: "But wait! There's more! Because she's had tea with the hermit of the Canyon!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1015!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Why she has even had a run in with Famlicus himself!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1016!SIDI.dialogue_text: "She quested for Luin, the ghelblade of the Green Jinn, but never found it..."

A.response_text: "Fascinating!"

E.response_text: "Stop talking!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1017!SIDI.dialogue_text: "And all this just in Kabu! She's been elsewhere questing, too!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.1018!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Or he... I'm not sure if she's a boy or girl."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X1019!SID.dialogue_text: "Oh well, gotta get back to my reading!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.201!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Oh! Well... there's Jer in the North, where the magi are cruel and treat their people like slaves!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Beyond the Wasteland is Zemes where all the people live in tents; they're supposed to be even stronger than Tacribians, OH! And they drink the blood of their enemies!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.2011!SIDI.dialogue_text: "And to the east there's Khindi where they hate the Vanquished and destroy all their ruins!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X2012!SID.dialogue_text: "Oh and there's even supposed to be a great plain of water and more countries beyond those whose names have been forgotten!"

A.response_text: "Thanks, Sidika. See you around."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X3010!SID.dialogue_text: "I guess I was wrong: some travelers ARE boring!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.401!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Hmmmm... Well, she did write about a land where the Obsidian Jinn ate the ghosts of the living and walked around in their skins..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "You don't think maybe that happened to her and..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.4011!SIDI.dialogue_text: "...All of Torma's books were actually written by the Obsidian Jinn!?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X4012!SID.dialogue_text: "Wow! I've got to read them all again now!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.501!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "I'm not just any child, you know!?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I'm an artisan's daughter and I know how to read!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X5011!SID.dialogue_text: "Biracul's bells! I don't like talking to jinnlickers! So goodbye!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5012!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Wow, you must think everyone is Famlaz in disguise?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.5013!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Well, maybe you won't get hurt that way, but you won't have any friends either!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!0.X601!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Well, they say he hides somewhere under a mountain, but it's supposed to be in another world. Maybe in reading the tomes of the Wayfarer you can learn more about it!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.X001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I'm studying Torma's translated texts and need to concentrate!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.003!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Look, I'm studying Torma's translated texts and need to concentrate!"

A.response_text: "Want to hear about what Torma wrote in Volume X?"

B.response_text: "Torma survived the Wasteland and wrote about it in volume X."

D.response_text: "A pity, I thought you'd be interested in his greatest work... Volume X."

E.response_text: "Why bother? You'll never be like him."

F.response_text: "Mind if I join you? I've got the one where Torma dies at the end!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.1001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "My father is super important and has all the volumes ever published, even the one that's only supposed to be in the Archives. But all those stop after volume VII!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.1002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Please, tell me what happens! I need to know!"

A.response_text: "...He decided to cease his adventuring life."

B.response_text: "Torma found the city of Ur'Ruk. After that, it doesn't say."

E.response_text: "If you want to know, journey there yourself and earn it..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "My father is super important and has all the volumes ever published, even the one that's only supposed to be in the Archives. But all those stop after volume VII!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Please, tell me what happens! I need to know!"

A.response_text: "...He decided to cease his adventuring life."

B.response_text: "Torma found the city of Ur'Ruk. After that, it doesn't say."

C.response_text: "The record is incomplete. Perhaps Torma ended there."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.4000!SIDI.dialogue_text: "My father is super important and has all the volumes ever published, even the one that's only supposed to be in the Archives. But all those stop after volume VII!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.4001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Please, tell me what happens! I need to know!"

C.response_text: "The record is incomplete. Perhaps Torma ended there."

D.response_text: "Perhaps we can share our knowledge..."

E.response_text: "If you want to know, journey there yourself and earn it."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5001!SIDI.dialogue_text: "You! You're a traveler! Help me be just like Torma!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5002!SIDI.dialogue_text: "What must I do? It's the only dream I've ever had!"

A.response_text: "...You must put away these childish dreams of yours."

D.response_text: "I can give you answers, but I need something in return..."

E.response_text: "Is that all Torma did? Dream?"

A.response_text: "...He decided to cease his adventuring life."

E.response_text: "Journey there yourself and earn this knowledge, weakling."

F.response_text: "Hard to say, really... His last words were apparently, 'Uuggggggh.'"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.1010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Guess I should have known that Torma was a man..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.1012!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I guess father was right after all..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I should've known even the Wasteland couldn't kill her!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2011!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I was too afraid to believe it..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2012!SIDI.dialogue_text: "But now I realize I've been afraid too long."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2013!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I'm gonna become a Wayfarer and write about my adventures! Just like her!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.2014!SIDI.dialogue_text: "And my first work'll be my goodbye letter to my father!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.401!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "OK! Here, take this super ultra rare Torma tome!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5011!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Torma didn't sit here in a comfy mansion all her life!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5012!SIDI.dialogue_text: "I'm gonna be a Wayfarer just like her and write all about it!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5013!SIDI.dialogue_text: "And my first work'll be my goodbye letter to my father!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.6010!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Guess I should have known that even Torma couldn't face the Wasteland."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.102!SIDIK.dialogue_text: "Here, you can have this Torma book."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.X1020!SID.dialogue_text: "I guess I won't be needing it anymore."

C.response_text: "The record is incomplete. Perhaps Torma ended there."

D.response_text: "Torma learned that a fool and her tomes are soon parted..."

E.response_text: "If you want to know, journey there yourself and earn it."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.5020!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Take this Torma book as a gift!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.X5021!SID.dialogue_text: "I'll be writing my own books from now on!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.X4030!SID.dialogue_text: "I hope the next tome you steal comes to life and bites your jinnlicking face off!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' MANSION!1.X901!SIDI.dialogue_text: "Gotta read up on crystals if I'm ever going to be a real artisan... like father."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: All around Eidos is a bustling plaza. Dominating the area is a marble fountain several stories tall and well over one hundred paces in diameter. A number of conversing turquoise-clad pairs stroll around the fountain, while a few individuals sit upon the fountain's lip and in its shade, seeking refuge from the midday sun.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Myriad pillars rise from the ground, supporting nothing but the open sky. They are all covered in remarkably beautiful mosaics depicting the history of the Daziran people - notable among them is one of a gallant female mage wielding a verdant spear as she charges into battle against pale, drooling abominations.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.0001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: One whole side of the area is open to the desert, allowing for a spectacular panoramic view of the desolate landscape - though to the south, constant dust cyclones kick up airborne sediment obscuring any distant landmarks. However, looking out from the mountains toward the east, a silver tower rejects the sun's rays, at once inviting and forbidding perception with its blinding reflections. The township beneath it is barely visible amid the brilliance.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.0002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Further along this railed viewing area appears to be a luxurious residential area. Eidos can hear the sound of hammers striking stone and other, less identifiable sounds coming from the Workshop towards the cloudstone.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.0003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: While most of the people in the immediate vicinity are strolling about already engaged in conversation, a select few seem to be available for a chat.

A.response_text: Walk towards the Workshop

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.0004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The familiar pillars with Daziran art cast long shadows from the midday's light; several people now hide among the shaded spots, attempting to thwart the sun's dastardly ploy to cook them alive. Those who have a more enviable spot in the cool penumbra of the fountain seem to have time and willingness to talk.

A.response_text: Walk towards the Workshop

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Three individuals look as though they are in no hurry to arrive at any particular destination.

A.response_text: A handsome man of indeterminate age

B.response_text: The gray-haired man wearing a turquoise robe

C.response_text: A sullen boy with a dirty face

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Gazing out from the guard rail, Eidos sees across the desert plain as far as the barrier of dusty cyclones permit. While comfortable within the finely tiled and pillar-shaded plaza, the oppressive and deadly heat of the arid landscape seems picturesque.\n\n\t\tFrom here, Eidos can approach a luxurious residential area, or else return to the Workshop and the cloudstone lift.

A.response_text: Walk towards the Workshop

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0099.000!DESC.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls to the tiles of the plaza floor, shouts from the Workshop herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.100!DESCR.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.101!DESCR.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.102!DESCR.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.103!DESCR.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.104!DESCR.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.105!DESCR.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!999.106!DESCR.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.000!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Get out of our township, you filthy barbarian!"

A.response_text: "Do you view all outsiders as barbarians?"

D.response_text: "My friend Khaa told me I'd be welcomed here... Was he mistaken?"

E.response_text: "Do not anger me, boy."

F.response_text: "What a spirited young lad! Catch any June bugs today?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.100!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "You don't get to ask questions here, you jinnlicking savage!"

A.response_text: "Do your parents let you speak this way?"

B.response_text: "I see there's no use reasoning with you."

E.response_text: "Khaa needs to keep his mongrels on tighter leashes."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.2000!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Foreign wenches don't scare anyone in Dazir!"

A.response_text: "Do your parents let you speak this way?"

B.response_text: "I see there is no use talking to you."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.300!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Not soon enough for me, so make like Quangjo and disappear!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.3000!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Because we don't like to have dung littering our streets."

B.response_text: "I see there's no point in continuing this conversation."

D.response_text: "I'll have to inform my friend Khaa of Dazir's poor manners."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4001!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "I'm so sorry, lady! Please forgive me! I didn't know!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4002!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Please don't hurt my mind! Not like Khaa's other foreign friend!"

C.response_text: "I'll let you off with a warning, brat. Now scram."

D.response_text: "Everything has its price... So, tell me of this 'other friend'."

E.response_text: "We must all reap what we sow, I'm afraid. Prepare yourself."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.500!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Or what?! I'm not afraid of you!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5000!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Tambul, Tacriba, you're all jinnlickers, the lot of you!"

A.response_text: "Do your parents let you speak this way?"

D.response_text: "I'll have to inform my friend Khaa of Dazir's poor manners."

E.response_text: "Shut your mouth now... before I fill it with your bowels."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6000!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Clean the dung out your ears, jinnlover!"

F.response_text: "A diss battle? My turn, you goat-sniffing, arse rat!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X1010!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "But illiterate jinnlovers like you wouldn't know anything about that, so shut it!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.301!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Ha! That shut your mouth up good, didn't it?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X3010!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "I hope the Jinns take you to the Graylands!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X3011!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "Sure thing, lady. Just please don't tell Khaa, please?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4010!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "I saw him walking down the street and called out to him..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.501!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "You talk so much from your arse, you must vomit up dung!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X5010!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "Go on, hit me! See what happens!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.50112!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "I don't want to have them again!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.601!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "Hey, wait! You can't say that to me!"

A.response_text: "Good luck! She's probably too busy preparing the ugly stick for your daily beating!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.X005!DIYGU!.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry! I'll be good, I swear it... on Biracul's name, I swear it!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.X0050!DIYGU.dialogue_text: "Get out of here, you jinnlicking weakling!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "I'm ill aware of what an outsider would be doing in Dazir at this odd season, but allow me to offer some friendly advice: do not venture into the Duskfang mountains through any of the passes."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you've heard, but we artisans were chased from there days ago by the new stewards of the Wellspring, and it is now deadly to all."

A.response_text: "Were the no warning signs?"

C.response_text: "I have no immediate plans to go there."

D.response_text: "Who are these new 'stewards' exactly..?"

E.response_text: "I, for one, haven't wasted my time learning useless skills."

F.response_text: "If they're the new stewards, then I'm the welcome wagon! Yee-ha!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.100!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The signs were there, but they were as a Vanquished tome to draugnir."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "How could we have possibly known that the many Neverborn laying dormant in the halls of the Wellspring would turn against us?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Yet, somehow they were indeed roused to violence and started attacking any they encountered."

A.response_text: "What will you do now?"

E.response_text: "Fools you are indeed to not have seen what was right under your noses."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.200!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "We don't know what caused these creatures to awaken, but they were definitely built by the same hands and minds that crafted the Wellspring itself."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.2000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "That they did no harm to the structure itself indicates that we are likely faced with the intended 'guardians' of the Wellspring."

A.response_text: "What will you do now?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Somehow they were roused from their slumber and began stirring in the halls of the Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Then the screams started echoing up from the lower halls..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4002!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The pitiful image of a junior copywriter remains seared into my memory..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4003!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "He... approached a beautiful red-haired specter. It was shortly after she emerged from one of the amber light fixtures."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4004!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunately, that was to be his final mistake as she erupted into an all-consuming sphere of energy, incinerating him instantly..."

D.response_text: "I'm sure a resourceful man such as you knows a way to combat them."

E.response_text: "Then I needn't worry. I'm no limp-wristed copyist."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.500!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "You mock the knowledge of our people... typical of a truth-blind savage."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "But I suppose you cannot teach a goat the seven melodies, now can you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Mark my words, outsider, the Vanquished had the greatest learning of all!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5002!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Whatever sordid brutality you may have learned in the desert will not help you against their creations."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5003!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "And know that even if the warriors of Tacriba destroy this township, they will be unable to overcome the Neverborn that have awakened!"

A.response_text: "Your learning hasn't done you much good, it seems."

D.response_text: "Then make yourself useful and tell me how to destroy these beings."

E.response_text: "You know nothing of brutality. But perhaps you'd care for a lesson?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The 'stewards' I speak of are monsters - Neverborn, in fact - and they are highly dangerous!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Thus, it would be unwise to attempt any journey into the Duskfang mountains."

F.response_text: "Okay, sure, but where can I get a wagon around these parts?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1010!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "A war with the Kaban illiterati across the canyon may ensue, should the gate in Tambul fall."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1011!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Thus, we must do what we can to prepare our defenses."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X1012!HAZAN.dialogue_text: "Go in the light of the Shining One, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1013!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The services of the learned are required in war as much as in peace."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1014!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "And knowing that the Kaban illiterati from across the canyon may make war upon us, we will then do far more to help our people than your transparent bravado."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1015!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "In any case, you have been dutifully warned; now you may do as you wish."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.201!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The Neverborn are just that: beings that live and yet, were not born of the womb like man or beast. They are the children of the Vanquished, wrought by the hands and minds of beings beyond our understanding."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.2010!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "None but a mage can speak to them, for their minds are said to be as unlike to ours as the scorpion's is to the lizard's."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X301!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Then may you walk in the light of the Shining One."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.401!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "The weaker of their ilk might be overcome by competent warriors, but those sentinels of living stone in the Chantry of the Martyr could be bested by no human!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4010!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps their forms could be crushed by a Jinn or their minds ensnared by the Ruby Jinn himself - but I sincerely doubt we'll be making allies of Jinns any time soon..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.501!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "But the Vanquished were unmatched in the learning of all things! If their will was to hide something, no living man could have..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5011!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "It's clear that I'm just trying to teach a goat the seven melodies..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5012!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard! You would need weapons of the like unseen since the Vanquished!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.50120!HAZAN.dialogue_text: "Even Khaa is powerless against these creatures! He too barely slipped out of the Wellspring before it sealed itself..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5013!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "If yours was anything more that flaccid braggadocio, I'm sure you would've already made good on your threats."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X601!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "I don't know why Khaa is letting a madwoman run loose in Dazir, but I'll thank you to leave as soon as you're able."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.000!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "If you'll excuse me, I have other matters to attend to and no time to speak."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.X001!HAZAN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul keep you from the Jinns, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.000!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Have you come in search of the secrets of the Vanquished, foreigner?"

A.response_text: "The Vanquished? Do you know much of them?"

B.response_text: "What are these secrets you speak of?"

C.response_text: "I'm just wandering around town right now."

D.response_text: "Only if they are of value..."

E.response_text: "No, I'm reconsidering my offer to save you miserable lot."

F.response_text: "Sounds like a heavy metal band; I'll pass."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.001!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Well, I fear you're in for an unpleasant surprise, as we Dazirans are not nearly so wise as we've claimed to be."

A.response_text: "But isn't that your function in the community of Kabu?"

B.response_text: "Then how do you control the Vanquished Wellspring?"

D.response_text: "So you've been deceiving your counterparts in the other townships..?"

E.response_text: "I gathered as much, having seen your humble achievements."

F.response_text: "We all have problems! I myself have a phantasmal wolf inside my noggin!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.002!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Not one for intellectual inquiry, I see."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X0020!SERPI.dialogue_text: "Well, good day and may Biracul guide you, outsider."

B.response_text: "On second thought, I would like to hear about the Vanquished."

F.response_text: "I have this rash that I was hoping you could look at for me..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.100!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Our function is - or rather, was - to maintain the Wellspring and the aqueducts that supplied all of the townships with water."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1000!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "However, in truth, we are little more than glorified stone masons."

A.response_text: "But surely, your expertise in maintaining the Wellspring is still unique."

B.response_text: "What is the nature of your knowledge?"

E.response_text: "Tell me how you control these ancient sites."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.200!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Well, if we had been in control of it, I doubt the Neverborn constructs would have chased us out of there like helpless fools."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.2000!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "What's worse is that we didn't even know they were lying dormant within."

A.response_text: "But surely, your expertise in maintaining the Wellspring is still unique."

B.response_text: "What, then, did you know about the Wellspring?"

C.response_text: "I'll have to take your word for it."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.3000!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Just look around you; does this look like the land of the learned to you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.3001!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard, we live little better than the farmers of Tambul!"

B.response_text: "How did Dazir become the intellectual capital of Kabu?"

C.response_text: "I'll have to take your word for it."

D.response_text: "Then who are the true masters of Kabu?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.400!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "Well, I wouldn't go so far as to say that..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4001!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Indeed, we do know more than most about the Vanquished, but we still do not properly understand them."

C.response_text: "I'll have to take your word for it."

D.response_text: "Then who are the true masters of Kabu?"

E.response_text: "Tell me how you control these Vanquished relics."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.500!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "You are quite free with your thoughts, aren't you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5000!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "But you are correct in that our achievements pale in comparison to those of the Vanquished."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5001!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "None have even come close in the millennia since their fall."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5002!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "We use their artifacts and structures, but what does the hunter know of metalcraft from simply throwing a spear?"

A.response_text: "But surely, your expertise in maintaining the Wellspring is still unique."

D.response_text: "Then who are the true masters of Kabu?"

E.response_text: "Tell me how you control these Vanquished objects."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6000!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "I've heard that exiles go mad in the Wasteland - that is until the draugnir eventually eat them..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6001!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "You wouldn't by chance have come from the Wasteland, would you?"

A.response_text: "I've heard none can survive the Wasteland."

F.response_text: "Damned if I know. My head seems to be empty... except for the wolf, of course."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.101!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "True, but I'm convinced magi and townships across the world each hold some unique knowledge."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1010!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Sadly, it's all scattered about in the six directions - and jealously guarded at that."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1011!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Undoubtedly, Biracul was right about communication being the key to civilization."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.1012!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Oh, if only we could freely cross the Wasteland! Like a modern-day Torma! Oh, the characters we'd meet! Magi in Jer, Zemes, Zhili or even Thiuda!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X1013!SERPI.dialogue_text: "Well... that's if those lands still exist, I suppose."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.10140!SERPI.dialogue_text: "A man named Ormenos came through here decades ago claiming to have done just that - though it's not known what eventually became of him after his exile; probably best to assume the simplest answer is the correct one."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.10141!SERPI.dialogue_text: "But if only we could freely cross the Wasteland, oh the characters would meet! Magi in Jer, Zemes, Zhili or even Thiuda!"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.201!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "There are a number of manuals inherited from the Shining One himself. They taught us the basics of architecture."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.2010!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "But they're written in an ancient script known only to magi and their chosen successors."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X2011!SERPI.dialogue_text: "I wonder what young Quangjo is up to these days, anyway."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.301!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "You just take everything at face value don't you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X3010!SERPI.dialogue_text: "Take care, foreigner; if the desert doesn't burned away your naivety, human interaction surely will."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4010!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "If you're a child and actually believe jinnlore, there is nothing Biracul did not know."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4011!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "But unless he steps out of the pages of a history book, you won't get a chance to ask him personally, now will you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.4012!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "So I suppose that makes us the most learned of Kabu and the best suited to lead, after all."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X4013!SERPI.dialogue_text: "Huh... So we've been right all along then..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.501!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "The Wellspring is actually quite self-sufficient through its use of synchronized crystals."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5010!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Essentially all we do is replace one exhausted crystal with a fresh one."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5011!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Shamefully, though, we can neither create nor revive crystals ourselves - none could besides Biracul, as far as we know."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5012!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Now, if you wish to know more of such things, seek out Behiye or Rashak - they should both be in the Workshop at this time of day."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5013!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "But if you do speak to them, be prepared to be..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.5016!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Those two are notorious for having crystal-powered jaws and an interminable Wellspring of words to share..."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X5017!SERPI.dialogue_text: "Don't say I didn't warn you, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.6010!SERPIL.dialogue_text: "Well, those illiterate apes across the canyon are probably plotting their ill-placed schemes of revenge as we speak."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!0.X6011!SERPI.dialogue_text: "And if they really do march on Dazir, you'd best make sure you and your 'wolf' are long gone by then."

F.response_text: "The wolf is telling me to leave... It says you're a lunatic."

KABU!DAZIR!ARTISANS' PLAZA!1.000!SERPIL!.dialogue_text: "I apologize, but I feel like that's enough conversation for right now."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the atrium. The air is thick with the sounds and smells of a local bazaar. No trees, no bushes, in fact no vegetation in sight at all makes the area look a bit stale and artificial. The upper tiers of the township loom over this lowest tier as a great awning, like a rocky cloud casting all in a perpetual shadow. Only the expansive atrium near the city walls escapes its gloomy cover.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking about at the vendors' stalls, Eidos notices a dearth of merchandise. Peddled wares do trade hands - but at what price, Eidos cannot surmise as both merchant and buyer appear to find the agreement disagreeable. Many locals walk about awkwardly avoiding the conspicuous foreigner's gaze. Even of the people who do not actively flee her, most are aloof and dismissive of her presence. Others just sit, mumbling to themselves with their haggard and worried faces.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: At the eastern edge of the township is a worn adobe wall, cracks visible even from this great distance. The wall roughly a story tall. At its center is what appears to be a gate - so clearly superior in its reflective metallic construction that is seems out of place. The gate itself is sealed by a massive, circular chunk of onyx. At the opposite end of the atrium is a large sandstone temple, which looks to have a number of folk burning incense at its perimeter.

A.response_text: Approach the Temple of Biracul

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X010!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking about the Atrium, Eidos surveys the folk. Most all of them seem beleaguered by menial tasks such as transporting goods, materials and water or sorting and preparing foodstuffs.\n\n\t\tThose in idleness seem to have their eyes cast upward, looking upon the narrow band of sky visible between the wall and the support structure of the upper level. Only a few seem open to her approach.

A.response_text: The woman in the magenta scarf

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.010!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The Atrium is hot and muggy through the mixing of the desert heat emanating from the walls and the sweat of the Daziran laborers. Though its perpetual shade under the awning of the upper tiers offers a silver lining.\n\n\t\tFrom here she can walk further into the lower living area towards the sandstone building where people are burning incense. Else, she can walk back to the Gates and the cloudstone Lift nearby.

A.response_text: Approach the Temple of Biracul

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
Approaching the Daziran temple, Eidos notes that its construction is strikingly similar to the domed structure in Khaa's Arboretum. Both are composed of simple but finely carved sandstone blocks, placed so precisely that even the finest blade would find no space to fit. Sturdy. Solid. But then again, so are most buildings in Dazir, even here on the lowest level.

		There are a number of golden-robed folk burning incense and chanting incantations at the door. Still others enter the structure with empty urns, passing those on their way out who carry overflowing jars, water splashing to the ground from their frivolous maneuvering.

		Beyond the temple itself seems to be a somewhat more dilapidated area of town, with people of equal caliber loitering around the area.

A.response_text: Enter the Temple of Biracul

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0099.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls to the packed dirt of the Atrium grounds, shouts from the cloudstone Lift herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.X000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.101!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.102!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.103!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.104!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.105!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!999.106!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.001!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's shining balls! Why are there so many homeless vagrants on the road these days?"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.002!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Do we look like a haven for the broken and unwanted?"

A.response_text: "Do you not think it your duty to accept all those in need?"

B.response_text: "Another one? There were other strangers in this township recently?"

D.response_text: "I'm no vagrant you cretin! I'm an ally to Khaa!"

E.response_text: "What'll be broken is your bones if you don't leave."

F.response_text: "I'm hardly unwanted, as your own mother can attest."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.100!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Ha! That's rich! You mistake us for those empty-headed Tambulan sheep."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1000!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "They're so busy falling over themselves to please everybody they can't do anything right."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1001!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Or that inept foreign mage who left as soon as the Wellspring shut down - it's probably his fault, too!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1002!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "But, no, we don't need outsiders in our town with their jinncursed ideas."

A.response_text: "Why suspect the foreign mage?"

B.response_text: "Why would people want to travel here?"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.200!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Not that it's any of your business, foreigner, but our architectural mastery and aesthetic prowess attract many gawkers like you."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2000!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "And, honestly, it's hardly our duty to feed and clothe these parasites."

A.response_text: "Parasites... I see. Have any caused trouble recently?"

C.response_text: "Well, I'll be on my way then."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X300!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Yes, you do that; your presence is not welcome here, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.400!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Oh, Biracul be praised! Please forgive my mistake, mistress!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4000!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Of course you understand that foreigner are rare in the Kabu region and foreign allies even rarer. And what with one being in town not long ago, I deduced you could be no one of... uh..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4001!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's grace, please forgive my misspeech! It's just that most foreigners have been among the undesirables."

D.response_text: "I see. Tell me more of these foreign allies."

E.response_text: "This riff-raff interests me. What they were doing here? Speak."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X500!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Um, well... I'd best be on my way..."

C.response_text: "I mean... excuse me I... uh... need to go..."

E.response_text: "She warned me you were a bit slow on the uptake."

F.response_text: "Shhhh! Not so loud! There are gremlins about."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.101!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Isn't it a little too coincidental that Khaa's new foreigner advisor would leave right after Kabu plunged into chaos?"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1010!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "He's a Jinn in disguise, if you ask me! And..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1011!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Hey! Why am I even answering your jinnlicking questions, foreigner?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.201!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "I suppose Khaa's new foreign friend has attracted some interest... No one seems to know where he's from nor do they seem care."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.401!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Yes! Of course! There was an outsider named Mifas'cul that became Khaa's primary advisor and confidant."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4010!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "He's rumored to have a mage's powers, but it's clear he doesn't hail from anywhere in Kabu - judging from the look of him."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4011!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "He's even visited the Wellspring at the top of the mountain. But now he's gone without a trace..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4012!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "In any case, I apologize for my insolence earlier!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.501!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Some vagabond was here not more than a month ago - in fact, he may still be lurking around here somewhere..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5010!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "His deluded followers were calling him the 'Prophet', though most of his predictions are pretty incoherent."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5011!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Once I heard the Prophet say, 'Conscientia will awaken. He will cast the Form of Hai unto the blood of the people. Their dead shall be beyond the count of the stars.'"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5012!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "What does any of that even mean!? There couldn't even possibly be that many people alive now or ever!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X5014!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "I'm going to kill you if you don't leave!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X601!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! Get away from me you jinnloving, lunatic!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X000!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Why don't you make like Quangjo and get lost?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X001!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Thanks for your service to Dazir, and may Biracul guide you!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X002!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "Bother me again and you'll be dancing with the Jinns in the Graylands!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.0020!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "I warned you! I'm going to send your ghost to the Graylands, jinnlover!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X003!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "...Oh! The sun goes down when the moon rises! Too-ra-loo!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X0030!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "...Oh! At night there be no jinnborn surprises! Too-ra-lee!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!1.X0033!JERHAAK!.dialogue_text: "...To don one of his many disguises! Hey!"

A.response_text: "No."

D.response_text: "...Of course not! I despise their kind."

E.response_text: "So what if I am?"

F.response_text: "No, I'm Stalphos. Tacribian? Who's that?"

A.response_text: "My appearance should be enough to convince you."

E.response_text: "You have my answer. Now, I suggest you move on citizen."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.200!MERT!.dialogue_text: "'Cause the folk o' Tacriba are dangerous sa'ages, ya fool!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2000!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Anyway, 'tis clear as the Empyrean tha' folk as thick as ya don' hail frem here anyway."

A.response_text: "I've not yet heard of an instance when they did your people harm."

B.response_text: "You seem to fear the people of Tacriba. Why?"

C.response_text: "Indeed I don't. Good day to you sir."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.3000!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I didn' aks if ya were jus' passin' through; I aks'ed if ya were frem Tacriba."

B.response_text: "You seem to fear the people of Tacriba. Why?"

C.response_text: "And I told you that I'm just passing through."

D.response_text: "Of course not! I despise their kind."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.400!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Good! Then ya have friends is us Dazirans!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4000!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I s'ppose ya heard tha' the Tacribian sa'ages be plannin' an invasion?"

D.response_text: "I have, and I would like to help your people deal with these ruffians."

E.response_text: "Only the weak fear battle. You aren't afraid are you?"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5000!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Now, where'd ya say ya were frem?"

A.response_text: "Nowhere. Best be on your way citizen; I grow weary of your prattle."

D.response_text: "I'm foreign to Kabu, but a friend to you and your people."

E.response_text: "I hear Tacribians are bloodthirsty and kill with little provocation..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.600!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's shiny balls! 'Tis no' a person's name!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.6000!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Why don' ya do us all a fa'or an' go fall inta Crescen' Canyon, ya Kharr lovin' fool!?"

F.response_text: "The only one I could ever love is Roostor!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.101!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I s'ppose ya don' look like one o' those sa'ages..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1010!MERT!.dialogue_text: "We can' be too careful though; 'haps they sen' spies among us!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X1011!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Off with ya now; go play with the Jinns on the plain or somethin'."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.201!MERT!.dialogue_text: "E'erybody knows the fac' tha' they're dang'rous!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X2011!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Bu' in any case, yer clearly no' a Tacribian and I ha'e gooder ways to spend ma time than talkin' to ya!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2012!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Arrrgg, talkin' ta ya is like tradin' words with a Suyu'i goa'lo'er frem Tambul!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2013!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Ne'er mind, bu' 'member, the Tacribians are dangerous."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X2015!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Bu' in any case, I ha'e gooder ways to spend ma time than talkin' to ya."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X301!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Arrrgg! Off with ya now, ya Suyu'i goa'lo'er; go play with the Jinns on the plain or somethin'."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.3010!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Then why didn' ya say tha' in the firs' place?!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.3011!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I don' trus' one as secreti'e as Rubied Famlaz!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X3012!MERT!.dialogue_text: "So ya be'er no' stay here long, ya fereign Jinn!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4010!MERT!.dialogue_text: "We'll owe ya if ya can stop those beasties!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4011!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Ey... 'haps ya came with tha' fereign mage, Khaa's new advisor..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4014!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I heard tha' he brang some gif's tha'll help us in this very war!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X4015!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Biracul be with ya, fereigner. I'm off to the temple!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4310!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Wull, the Tacribians are plannin' to invade. No' to worry though, Khaa's a crafty leader, he is."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4311!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Rumor says, he's go' the help o' a mage frem a fereign land!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4312!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I don' know wha' they plannin', bu' I heard tha' the Tacribians won' be a threa' if all goes to plan!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X4313!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I'm off to the temple to do Biracul's work!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4510!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Tha' Khaa's a crafty leader, he is!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4511!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Rumor says, he's go' the help o' a mage frem a fereign land."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4512!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I don' know wha' they be plannin', bu' I heard tha' the Tacribians won' be a threa' if all goes to plan!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4513!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Bu'... Hey! 'Tis no' my job to brin' sigh' to the blind!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X501!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Oh, um... good day to ya, fereigner..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X6010!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Yer in the Jinn's embrace, ya looney!"

A.response_text: "Buck-kaw! Hear the mighty caw of my lord!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X102!MERT!.dialogue_text: "No reason fer ya to linger, ya Suyu'i goa'lo'er!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.202!MERT!.dialogue_text: "I hear yer the fereigner who'll fix the Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2020!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Ya should go take care o' tha' soon!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X2021!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Only ol' Famlaz hisself could guess wha' the sa'age Tacribians'll do if ya don' go soon!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X502!MERT!.dialogue_text: "Look, I don' wan' any trouble; jus' leave me be."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "What's a wanderer like you doing in the township of Dazir? You're not from Kabu, are you?"

A.response_text: "In truth, I know little of this region and its people."

B.response_text: "My goal is to learn of this whole land and its history."

C.response_text: "I go wherever whim and chance take me."

D.response_text: "I look for the strongest allies... Have I come to the right place?"

E.response_text: "Why're all you Dazirans so nosy?"

F.response_text: "I come from a distant land, in search of the Jade Monkey."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.100!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "You're free with your mind! A laudable trait, yet there are some that might take advantage of it."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you'd find yourself more at home in the land of Tambul, my true homeland."

A.response_text: "What do people in Tambul do?"

B.response_text: "Are people the next town over really that different?"

E.response_text: "The strong fear not the schemes of the weak. I've nothing to hide."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.200!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "I can tell you a little lore, but the township of Tambul is more interested in that sort of knowledge than the folk of Dazir."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "You would find more experts on history if you made a journey to the east."

A.response_text: "What do people in Tambul do?"

B.response_text: "What can you tell me about the origins of Kabu?"

C.response_text: "Maybe the wind will take me there someday. After all life is unpredictable."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.300!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Then take care chance doesn't lead you blindly into a pit of vipers, outsider..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.3000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "The Tacribians have little tolerance for aimless travelers and the monsters of the Wasteland consume the unwary."

C.response_text: "I doubt I have much say in my fate. one way or another."

D.response_text: "If I have my way, I'll elude death entirely."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.400!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "That all depends on how one defines strength, I suppose."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Biracul envisioned truth strength as the Dialectic - that is, one's ability to interact with one's neighbors and to draw on their power and wisdom."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4001!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "And Archmage Ark embodied this definition of strength."

C.response_text: "Regardless, I doubt it's so easy to change one's nature."

D.response_text: "I believe strength is life, the weak thus consigned to the grave."

E.response_text: "I will not be poisoned by the fallacies and errors of the weak-willed."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.500!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Ho ho! Forgive me, but though I live in Dazir, I am not of it."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "I was born in Tambul, which may explain my interest in you."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.5001!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "You see, most folk of Dazir take little notice of others except out of fear."

A.response_text: "What are people in Tambul good at? Espionage?"

D.response_text: "Fear is the gift given to the weak on their way to the grave."

E.response_text: "Daziran or Tambulan, I'm sure you all bleed the same."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.600!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Intriguing... I had never heard of such a thing..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.6000!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Do you think you could tell me more of this artifact? Is it of Vanquished build?"

C.response_text: "Why bother? Without the Monkey, fate is the only true master in the universe..."

D.response_text: "I've heard the Monkey can grant eternal life."

F.response_text: "You can't fool me! I know you know where the Monkey is!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.101!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "We are Cultivators - though here we are derided as mere farmers. Ours is the business of creation."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.1010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "If it's knowledge of life and the folk of the world you seek, travel east to my homeland."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X1011!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Gotta go now! Biracul be with you, outsider!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.201!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "The people of Dazir, Tambul and Tacriba were once a single nomadic tribe that migrated here from the south."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "The current specialization of our people was the result of the influence of the Shining One. With his teaching we have become masters of various tasks that allow us to lead a civilized life!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.2011!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "But it's getting late, so I should go now."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X2012!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Good luck on your quest for knowledge and may Biracul guide you!"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.301!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, but someone who believes they have no power over their own life surely sacrifices it to the will of another."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X3010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Good luck, outsider, and may Biracul be with you."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.401!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Then all of us are weak, for mortality is our very nature."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.4010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "No, you will not find the secrets of immortality in the settlements of humanity, better to look for such power in the desert or the Wasteland instead."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X4011!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you can learn from a draugnir... or something worse..."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.501!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "You'd find yourself in good company in Tacriba, you know. Their leader Khlutt is a proud man and thinks as you do."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X5010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps they will conquer Dazir and give you a demonstration of this 'strength' you so idolize."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.6010!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "...really don't know what you are talking about."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.6011!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "But perhaps you might wish to research the writings of Torma the Wayfarer?"

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.6012!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "He was said to have ranged farther than any man! Perhaps he has heard of this... Jade Monkey."

KABU!DAZIR!ATRIUM!0.X6013!PEMBE!.dialogue_text: "But now I must be on my way! Good day, outsider."

KABU!DAZIR!CLOUDSTONE!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Stepping onto the hefty disk, Eidos feels it shift slightly as it adjusts to the new load. As it settles the artifact beams with the expectation of a command - clearly the result of some unseen Glyphcraft at work. The disk desires to transport Eidos to some vertically distant destination...

A.response_text: To the top and Khaa's Arboretum

B.response_text: To the middle and the Workshop

C.response_text: To the bottom and the Atrium

KABU!DAZIR!CLOUDSTONE!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The massive disk silently propels Eidos skyward, giving her time to regard the people of Dazir. The comparative crudeness of their vestments and the relative indelicate surrounding architecture stand in stark contrast to the singular marvel she now rides. Its operation, though seemingly understood by the Dazirans, is clearly not replicable by them or their ilk. The artifact is as alien to them as immortality, or perhaps as strange as omniscience.\n\n\t\tAnd thus, the mysterious mechanism of unknown origin graciously transports Eidos to her destination.

KABU!DAZIR!CLOUDSTONE!0.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
The massive disk silently transports Eidos to the second tier of Dazir. The soft buzzing of passing air is gradually replaced by clattering tools and collaborative calls from scores of people.

		A spacious workshop then comes into view, filled with workbenches and tools ranging from crudely fashioned metallic implements to genuinely magical artifacts. The voices heard previously belong to workers and artisans, calling to each other as they coordinate their efforts to birth creations both bizarre and mundane.

		Stopping at ground level, Eidos steps forth from the platform.

KABU!DAZIR!CLOUDSTONE!0.003!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The lift halts its descent and Eidos stands in the lowest level of Dazir. Unlike above, the floors here are made of plain dirt and dust, pounded soild by thousands of footfalls. The area here is decidedly darker, with wide, rough support structures and the town walls blocking much of the sunlight. Not far from here are the limits of the Daziran walls and its only gate to the outside world.

A.response_text: Use the cloudstone
CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text:
Walking up to the walls of Dazir, her trek is halted by a circular slab of dark yet resplendent onyx. Three to four times her height in diameter, it stands dispassionately before her, blocking the archway that serves as the entrance to the township. Canting her head skywards, Eidos sees no presence at the top of the walls, no sign of activity at her approach - though she can faintly hear the sound of human voices distantly echoing from the stone slopes encompassing the township.

		Looking beyond the gate, Eidos sees that vertically stacked tiers recess into the mountain the higher they go. The lowest level is invisible from this vantage point, but the top two levels give hints of the presence of master builders. The structures, though not of Vanquished caliber, are far from crude and the lush vegetation on the upper two levels - especially the uppermost - seem alien to the local desert's desolate flora.

		Stretching out from the mountains like hardened veins are two stony aqueducts. One leads across the desert towards the settlement with the silver tower, glittering in the east and the other first bends south, then turning sharply toward the east and across the canyon.

A.response_text: Go east toward the other settlement

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.X0010!DESCRI.dialogue_text:

		Stretching out from the mountains like hardened veins are two stony aqueducts. One leads across the desert towards the settlement with the silver tower, glittering in the east and the other first bends south, then turning sharply toward the east and across the canyon.

		What next catches her attention is a man arranging his travel pack, apparently about to set off on the journey to his next destination.

A.response_text: Go east toward the other settlement

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Walking up to the walls of Dazir, her trek is halted by a circular slab of dark yet resplendent onyx. Three to four times her height in diameter, it stands dispassionately before her, blocking the archway that serves as the entrance to the township. As she draws nearer, the barricade begins to rise. While there is a loud grating of stone on stone, there is no sound of machinery. As the gate is opened Eidos sees a few scantly armed guards within, gripping their wooden cudgels warily, their eyes looking past Eidos and out onto the Jenowin Plain, as though trying to will the fuming mirages into distinguishable shapes. They are truly on edge.\n\n\t\tAs soon as she crosses the threshold, the block slowly returns to its resting place, looking for all the world as if it is being gently set down by the hand of some invisible giant.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.X0020!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Walking up to the walls of Dazir, her trek is halted by a circular slab of dark yet resplendent onyx. They are truly on edge.\n\n\t\tAs Eidos is entering, she notices a man is exiting.

A.response_text: Enter Dazir

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.X003!DESCRIP.dialogue_text:
Walking up to the walls of Dazir, her trek is halted by a circular slab of dark yet resplendent onyx. Three to four times her height in diameter, it stands dispassionately before her, blocking the archway that serves as the entrance to the township. Canting her head skywards, Eidos sees no presence at the top of the walls, no sign of activity at her approach. In fact, a maddening absence of any sound whatsoever suggests the place has been abandoned.

		Then the gates yawn with a terrible grating of stone on stone as they open up revealing an armed contingent of guards and a rather extravagantly garbed fellow, walking with the gait of a man trying to hide his painful awareness of his inadequacies.

		He approaches Eidos, possibly to discuss her recent, violent actions at the Dawn Fortress...

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.500!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos stares at the massive onyx slab acting as the gate of Dazir. It stands completely immobile, showing not even a hint of a reaction when Eidos approaches it. Nearby is nothing but a sign, simply stating: 'The Gates Shall Not Be Opened for Any Without Express Permission from our glorious mage-leader Khaa.'

A.response_text: Return to the cloudstone

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.X000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Dysmas simply chuckles, waving his farewell. Eidos is left with but two options.

A.response_text: Go east toward the other settlement

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.X500!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The guards usher Eidos in, not wanting to leave the gates open for even another instant. As soon as she crosses the threshold, the block gradually returns to its resting place, looking for all the world as if it is being gently set down by the hand of some invisible giant.

A.response_text: CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!9.X0000!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Eidos is led to the high archway that serves as the sole exit to the outside world. As the guards escort her closer, the massive, circular stone slab that blocks the gate begins to steadily levitate, looking for all spectators as if it is being gently lifted by the hand of some invisible giant.

		The block is set down once more after she has crossed the threshold. Now on the outside, Eidos looks beyond the gate at the vertically stacked tiers of Dazir. The lowest level is invisible from this vantage point, but the top two levels give hints of the presence of master builders. The structures, though not of Vanquished caliber, are far from crude and the lush vegetation on the upper two levels - especially the uppermost - seem alien to the local desert's desolate flora.

		Stretching out from the mountains like hardened veins are two stony aqueducts. One leads across the desert towards the settlement with the silver tower, glittering in the east and the other first bends south, then turning sharply toward the east and across the canyon.

A.response_text: Go east toward the other settlement

		The block is set down once more after she has crossed the threshold. Now on the outside, Eidos looks beyond the gate at the vertically stacked tiers of Dazir. The lowest level is invisible from this vantage point, but the top two levels give hints of the presence of master builders.
