A.response_text: Go east toward Tambul

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!10.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: At the gates, the guards bind Eidos' hands behind her back, then covering her head with a burlap sack. She hears whispering townfolk murmur scattered words and phrases.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!10.004!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Finally, a guard brutishly shoves her indicating that they are starting their slow march to her exile.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0099.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls against the unyielding stone of the Daziran gate, shouts from the Atrium herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.102!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.103!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.104!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.105!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!999.106!DESCRI.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

F.response_text: "I follow the mighty Caw of Roostor!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.5000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Though to be fair, you won't even be getting into Dazir, given that I was the last one allowed to enter or exit the township."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.600!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "...You mean the mage of Dazir, Khaa?"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.6000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, I doubt he summoned you, as he's a very particular man, from what I hear."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.1010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I urge you to come and explore Tambul if you get the chance."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.1011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "The Hydroponics Facility is a marvel of Biraculian innovation and the Moon Tower is truly a sight to behold - just another reminder of how little we yet know compared to the Vanquished."

A.response_text: "I shall endeavor to make it out there soon!"

B.response_text: "You seem to suggest Tambul is the best place to visit."

E.response_text: "I'm afraid Tambul is not high on my priority list."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.201!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Eidos, is it? Well Biracul smile upon you Eidos!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.2010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Be careful out there on the Jenowin Plain. It has a rather unforgiving way of punishing the unprepared, and what's worse it's said to be ol' Famlaz's home. So, don't stray from the road if you continue your travels."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.2011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Biracul be with you and farewell, Eidos!"

A.response_text: "Farewell, Dysmas."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.2012!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, Tambul is certainly the friendliest of the townships in Kabu. You'd do well to visit it!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.2013!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "In any case, I'm sorry, but I really must get going now; I've delayed my return for far too long!"

A.response_text: "Farewell."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.3010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "A piece of parting advice for you: be wary of the Jenowin Plain. It neither welcomes nor encourages our presence, and its said to be home to ol' Famlaz himself!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.3011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "And I see that there seems to be a dust storm approaching from the south; you'd do well to find yourself some shelter soon!"

A.response_text: "Farewell."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.3014!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, may Biracul still smile upon you, quiet one!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.401!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "We don't need to be friends to be friendly, you know..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.4010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you're a disciple of the Ruby Jinn - secrecy and evasion your tools..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.4011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "In any case, I'd best be on my way, traveler. Stray not from the roads, though, or else you might genuinely encounter the Ruby Jinn himself."

D.response_text: "Now you mustn't speak ill of secrecy and evasion, Dysmas!"

E.response_text: "I will never bow down to any master."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.501!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Wow... Words as cutting as Ark's blade!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.5010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I suppose that's my cue to leave, any ways. Most of us Kabans aren't fond of a Famlazlover, after all!"

A.response_text: "Yes, leave."

D.response_text: "There's plenty of sand out there for you to hide your head in."

E.response_text: "My words aren't the only thing that cut."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.601!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, uh... Stalphos... it has certainly been a most 'peculiar' pleasure to make your acquaintance..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!0.6010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "May the Shining One smile upon you!"

F.response_text: "And may the Feathered One shield you from gremlins!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well if it isn't the hero of the moment! Biracul smile upon you, Eidos."

A.response_text: "You have me at a disadvantage: you know my name, but I don't know yours."

C.response_text: "I'm no hero. I'm simply along for the ride."

D.response_text: "I'm the talk of the town then, am I?"

E.response_text: "Hero? Not quite. Rightful queen is more accurate."

F.response_text: "No! I'm the Hero of Tomorrow, not the Moment."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.100!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "The name is Dysmas. It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.1000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I hope your work in the Wellspring can restore some peace and order in Kabu - far too long have we lived under the shadow of the Jinns!"

A.response_text: "Where are you headed?"

E.response_text: "Soon you'll live under my shadow instead."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.200!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, the whole town knows about the foreign Farcaster-user by now. Khaa also spread the word that you'd be entering the Wellspring to set things right in there."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.2000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I'd wager that those Tacribians are a bit parched by now and could use the water!"

A.response_text: "Is that where you're headed? To the Dawn Fortress?"

B.response_text: "Why does water no longer flow from the Wellspring?"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.300!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "That's a rather odd attitude to take when you've pledged yourself to a cause so dangerous..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.400!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, the whole town knows about the foreign Farcaster-user by now. Khaa also spread the word that you'd be entering the Wellspring to set things right in there."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I'd wager that those Tacribians are a bit parched by now and could use the water!"

D.response_text: "What would happen in the unfortunate event of a mishap?"

E.response_text: "You sound more like you're cursing them than sympathizing."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.500!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! You'd better not let Khaa hear you say that; he's not known for his tolerance - even if you are helping him to clean up his mess in the Wellspring..."

A.response_text: "Tell me why you're leaving, Dysmas"

D.response_text: "Will Khaa tolerate your criticisms, then?"

E.response_text: "Maybe I should clean up the trash outside his city gate while I'm at it."

F.response_text: "Tomorrow never comes! So I feel less pressure to perform."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.101!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I'm heading home to Tambul, finally - been gone far too long!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.1010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Speaking of which, I should be off now. Biracul keep you from Famlicus, Eidos!"

A.response_text: "Safe travels."

E.response_text: "Biracul keep poor Famlicus from me is more like it."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.201!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Long has Famlicus' shadow been cast over Kabu! Historically, the Ruby Jinn makes appearances to signal some new tragedy - such as the current one with the Wellspring..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.2010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Our people have been writing about it for centuries!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.2011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "And what's more, recently after people from different townships had been waking up in cold sweats claiming to have seen his crimson robe, then the Wellspring suddenly stopped the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.2012!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Not many would claim it as a mere coincidence, surely."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.2013!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "In any case, I'd best be on my way. Good luck with your work, Eidos. Your burden is the heaviest of us all."

A.response_text: "Thanks for your encouragement."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.3010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, may Biracul still smile upon you! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.3011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Hope you can take care of this Wellspring problem soon! Farewell!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, I guess all the Tacribians would die then... that is unless they figured out a way to get passed the Gate of Celestial Judgment without getting vaporized..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Doubtful they could, though, because I'm sure that if they could do it, they would have already done it by now."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4012!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, it's been nice chatting with you, Eidos, but I should be on my way."

D.response_text: "Farewell and stay hydrated..."

E.response_text: "I'm glad you finally decided to leave."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4013!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I know better than to cross Khaa - and you would do well to not cross him yourself."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4014!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "The sooner you finish doing what you promised him, the better."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.4015!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "In any case, I need to be on my way. Biracul smile upon you, Eidos."

D.response_text: "Thanks for your 'sage' advice."

E.response_text: "I'll finish when I damn well please."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.5011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I wouldn't even dream of cursing my brothers and sisters at the Dawn Fortress!"

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.5012!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "No, for me, humor is just a way of making the unbearable resemble its opposite."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.5013!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, in any case, I must be off. Biracul smile upon you, Eidos."

A.response_text: "Yes, leave."

D.response_text: "Don't forget to stay hydrated..."

E.response_text: "Perhaps you're not as funny as you think."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.601!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, uh, it has certainly been a most 'peculiar' pleasure to make you acquaintance..."

KABU!DAZIR!GATES OF DAZIR!1.6010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "May the Shining One smile upon you!"

F.response_text: "May the Feathered One shield you from gremlins!"

A.response_text: CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Linen sheets tickle fingertips. Beads of sweat rest precariously on a forehead. A dozen tendrils of candle smoke weave their way into a nose. Two sticks chatter and echo as they gently knock against each other.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.0002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: A dryness of throat that would make desert sand seem moist.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos' eyelids crack open, eyes failing to produce even a single tear of lubrication. From what the scattered light halos can tell her, she lies upon a bed, in a windowless room lit by the flickering of countless burning candles. Haze gives way to clarity as her eyes begin to focus. Rocking near her in a chair is an elderly woman, calmly and conscientiously knitting.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X0010!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As Eidos stirs, the woman suddenly looks up with a startled expression. But her surprise-contorted features soon ease into a timeworn smile of unparalleled kindness, framed in the wrinkles wrought from decades of caring for others.

A.response_text: DIP

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X100!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos raises her head and attempts to speak, only managing to produce an indecipherable rasp. The woman quickly pours a cup of water from a clay decanter and hands it to her. Overwhelmed by the sudden memory of thirst, Eidos drinks deeply.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X300!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos lies still and looks about the room. The woman pours a cup of water from a clay decanter and hands it to her. Though overwhelmed by the sudden memory of thirst, Eidos accepts the cup only tentatively.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X500!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Beginning to sit up, Eidos struggles to upright herself, the elderly woman simply raising a skeptical eyebrow. Rada begins to move toward a clay carafe before being brushed aside by an impatient Eidos, who lifts the vessel to her lips, drinking ravenously.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X600!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Beginning to sit up, Eidos struggles to upright herself, the elderly woman simply raising a skeptical eyebrow. Rada begins to move toward a clay carafe before being brushed aside by an impatient Eidos. Darting towards the container as though in a race, she arrives and throws her hands in the air celebrating her victory. In a fit of ecstasy, as if having achieved her lifelong dream, Eidos lifts the vessel and pours it all over her head, a steady deluge of fresh water dousing her entire person. After shaking herself dry like some farmyard beast, she punctuates the performance with a resounding caw.\n\n\t\tStands dumbfounded only able to stare for a few moments. As Eidos begins to stare back, entering into another competition of her imagination with the elderly woman, Rada comes to and begins weaving the thread of conversation anew.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.004!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Duty-bound, Rada works hard to vacate her seat. Each push closer toward standing causes her to teeter on the edge of collapse. Yet her ancient muscles somehow prevail over time and gravity’s cruel conspiracy, allowing her to finally gain an upright position. Thus, Rada and her sturdy cane begin their three-legged trek to fetch Khaa.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.0040!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Alone and uncertain, Eidos renews her inspection of the room. The meager candles cast deep shadows across walls of white plaster, but provide enough light to gain a cursory understanding of the chamber's layout. The bed upon which she rests is finely carved and stained to a ebony hue. The sheets and bedding are fresh, but the room, for all its finery, is bare bones and clearly meant for servants.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X0041!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can complete her survey, however, Rada returns, this time following another individual. A man dressed in fine, black silk and a feathered hat impatiently parades into the chamber. With his mouth so twisted by a perpetual scowl and his expression so full of self-importance, it is a wonder he has room for eyes and a nose.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: At Eidos' words, Khaa's breath seems to cease. His eyes narrow before silently nodding for her to continue.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Khaa stares suspiciously at Eidos. Calculating. Evaluating. Machinating. It is some time before he speaks again.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X005!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Khaa closes his eyes to concentrate, placing his fingertips upon his forehead. Eidos, caught unaware, then feels a surge of energy course through her body and into her mind, delving into all corners in a desperate search for some important memory.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!09.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Khaa puts two fingers to his temple, and within a heartbeat, two guards arrive to escort Eidos away.

A.response_text: Comply

E.response_text: Attack

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!10.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Khaa exits the room. With a jerking nod of his head, he motions for Eidos to follow.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!11.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos enters Khaa's abode and sees the mage ponderously reviewing documents at his desk. The elderly mage feigns indifference and with a quick glance upwards acknowledges her presence, casting his eyes back down to his papers with equal haste. Despite his show of disinterest, he speaks to her with the eagerness that belies his charade.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!11.X900!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: With a dismissive wave of his hand, Khaa finishes the conversation and returns to his work.

A.response_text: Return to the Arboretum

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0099.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: As her elderly victim falls onto the tiled floor of the abode, Eidos sees that she has been joined by a severe looking man in rich robes and an ornate hat. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!990.00!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: As Eidos pushes the unhinged door open, it loses its final grip in the frame and collapses to the ground, kicking up the dust of debris. The fine and luxurious plasterwork, furniture and decorations that once served as testament to the power and affluence of Dazir is now but a memory. Desperate and greedy hands have lain ruin to every object of beauty that was not looted. Nothing remains unsullied or unbroken. Windows shattered. Paintings torn. Statues toppled and fragmented.\n\n\t\tAll that remains for Eidos is to return to the Arboretum.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.X000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.100!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.101!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.102!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.103!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.104!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.105!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!999.106!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.000!EIDOS!.dialogue_text: "The path to the Wellspring will be revealed. Before you stands one that can make use of the Farcaster!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.002!EIDOS!.dialogue_text: "And remember Khaa, there can be no life without order."

A.response_text: CHECKER

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It's neither my wont nor my desire to chat with wandering vagrants; however, your jinnstruck ravings were of particular interest to me, and thus I commanded my subjects to save your life."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X0000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I am Khaa, mage and leader of the Biraculian township of Dazir. Who are you and how did you come to be here?"

A.response_text: "I came bearing a message from Mifas'cul."

B.response_text: "Do you understand why Mifas'cul sent me?"

C.response_text: "Once I impart my message, I'll depart."

D.response_text: "I'm a messenger from your foreign ally."

E.response_text: "I compel you to listen! Mifas'cul has sent me here."

F.response_text: "I met another funny-hat man in the desert!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I see... So you have been sent here because of your ability to make use of the Farcaster."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.002!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I hadn't foreseen this stroke of good fortune, but your appearance explains much."

A.response_text: "Who is Mifas'cul?"

D.response_text: "What does this explain?"

E.response_text: "No one sends me anywhere!"

F.response_text: "I doubt anything could explain your hat, buddy."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "He's an ally to the township of Dazir, a foreign mage with a mastery of Techne and knowledge of ancient lore."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.1000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "He must have used his abilities to guide you to us in our time of need. For you see, we require your Farcasting Techne, foreigner."

A.response_text: "What's wrong here?"

E.response_text: "I'm uninterested in your plight."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.200!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You do not know..? Strange that you can use it yet you are unaware that it is a relic left behind by the Vanquished..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.2000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While the knowledge of such things comes easily to the folk of Dazir, none have been able to awaken a Farcaster in living memory."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.2001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But more importantly, our need for such an ability couldn't be greater than it is now. For you see, we require your Farcasting Techne, foreigner."

A.response_text: "What's wrong here?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.300!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "There is nothing wrong with your mind, other than weakness."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.3000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It is simply that Techne has a profound effect on the uninitiated and Mifas'cul is a master. The residual effects of his message had temporarily disrupted your thought patterns, but that has all passed now."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.3001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "What's more important is that he has guided you to us in our time of need. For, you see, we require your Farcasting Techne, foreigner."

D.response_text: "How can I become mentally stronger?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.400!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Why a foreigner like you would be wandering in the desert to find yourself here, for one. Only madness or Techne could compel one to brave such a perilous journey."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.4000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Fortunately, the weakness of your mind has caused you to arrive in our time of need. For you see, we require your Farcasting Techne, foreigner."

D.response_text: "How can I become mentally stronger?"

E.response_text: "I care nothing for your people or their problems."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.500!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "How do you explain your presence here? Or indeed, the unbidden words that just escaped your lips?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.5000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No, even a draug-witted foreigner such as you cannot doubt the power of Techne."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.5001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Like it or not, Mifas'cul has sent you here to assist us, and we require your Farcasting Techne, foreigner."

A.response_text: "Then why have I been drawn here?"

D.response_text: "Explain the nature of this Techne."

E.response_text: "Yet, it hasn't made me care about you or your plight."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.600!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I imagine the finer things of the civilized world would be lost on an outlander such as you - though I hope your boorishness won't interfere with the assistance you are to give me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.6000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You see, you have been sent here due to your ability to Farcast, foreigner."

A.response_text: "What's wrong here?"

E.response_text: "I'm uninterested in your plight."

F.response_text: "If you need to destroy the gremlin menace, I'm with you all the way."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.201!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Such matters are the purview of magi alone, and before I would even consider bestowing the gift of this knowledge, I would first need to rectify the problems that have beset my subjects."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X2010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, be still as I peer into your true nature..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.501!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I would think less of you if you were to care for people and causes of which you knew nothing. However, before I enlighten you, there is something I must do..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.601!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Gremlins... yes... they can be a problem..."

F.response_text: "Sure... the worst! Though your bad breath is a close second."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.6010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes, well... You see, gremlins have infested our sacred Wellspring!"

F.response_text: "Go on!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!00.X6011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "They must be purged if our township is to survive!"

F.response_text: "GASP! The plot thickens!"

A.response_text: DIP

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You strike me as a person concerned with the well-being of others... Do I misjudge you, or would you be interested in an undertaking that would preserve the lives of my people?"

A.response_text: "What is it that threatens this place and its people?"

B.response_text: "I'm more concerned with truth and understanding."

E.response_text: "I'm listening."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.200!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No doubt an inquisitive individual such as yourself is interested in learning and understanding... We Dazirans can be of assistance to you in this matter."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, this is only if you can complete a simple task that will ensure the survival of my people."

A.response_text: "What is it that threatens this place and its people?"

B.response_text: "How can you help me learn what I wish to know?"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.300!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I can see how hard you try to walk a noncommittal path. That road has come to an end for you, I'm afraid."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "For you see, a great disaster looms, and those who do nothing to thwart genocide, are only aiding its cause!"

B.response_text: "Your problems are your own; I only wish to learn and understand."

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "Who would be so cruel to do such a thing!?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.400!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You are a crafty one - or at least, you aim to be..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yet you have not mastered your mental defenses, thereby allowing others to unweave the threads of your memories with the greatest of ease."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're most fortunate indeed that we currently have a use for you!"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "Who would be so brazen to stand against you..?"

E.response_text: "Stop wasting my time and get to the point."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.500!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Despite facing beings that could tear your mind to shreds, you still feel no fear..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Dazir could use someone with your talents."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Our foes are ruthless, and I mean to respond in kind!"

A.response_text: "Why have you made such dangerous enemies?"

D.response_text: "Who would be so brazen to stand against you!?"

E.response_text: "Stop wasting my time and get to the point!"

F.response_text: "Delectable? Lubricated? Thoughty?"
"'As odd as you are ugly!' I always like to say."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes... well, I imagine you would welcome a chance to prove your mettle as a true hero, isn't that right Mistress... Gremlinsbane?"

F.response_text: "Indeed, I come to rid the land of the gremlin menace!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.101!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Dazir is menaced by the people of Tacriba, the township of barbarians located beyond the Crescent Canyon to the east."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Since the time of Ark, the Tacribians have always made their way in the world with the violence of the Amethyst Jinn. Why, even as we speak, they're preparing to march on our magnificent settlement!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "All that stands between them and us are two Vanquished gates. Mighty obstacles though they may be, I'd prefer a more... permanent solution."

A.response_text: "For what reason would they do this?"

E.response_text: "Why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.201!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're fortunate indeed to find yourself in Dazir! For we are the most learned and skillful of the peoples of Kabu."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Alas, the illiterate tribe of Tacriba means to destroy us. And if they succeed, all of our priceless knowledge will be lost!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Help us and our centuries of learning will be yours!"

A.response_text: "Why would Tacriba do this?"

B.response_text: "What kind of knowledge does Dazir possess?"

C.response_text: "I'm an outlander; this feud doesn't interest me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As the Tacribian tribe seeks to dominate this region, their folly concerns the actions of all people of Kabu, as well as those 'in' Kabu."

B.response_text: "What kind of knowledge does your civilization possess?"

C.response_text: "I'm an outlander; this feud doesn't interest me."

D.response_text: "Why is your survival at stake?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.401!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Khlutt, the brutish leader of the Tacribian tribe, that's who!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "That truth-blind Famlazlover covets control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us at the moment, Tacriba is no doubt seeking a way to circumvent this obstacle."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "We have secured the base of the aqueduct leading to the Dawn Fortress with a contingent of crystal experts ready to demolish it, should they attempt to pass the canyon using the aqueduct."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4013!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But Khlutt is as crafty as he is pernicious... It's only a matter of time before he finds a way across to massacre every living being on this side of the canyon!"

C.response_text: "The affairs of others don't concern me."

D.response_text: "What interest does this barbarian have with your Wellspring..?"

E.response_text: "And why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.501!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You see, those jinncursed Tacribians covet control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us at the moment, Khlutt is no doubt seeking a way to circumvent this obstacle."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "We have secured the base of the aqueduct leading to the Dawn Fortress with a contingent of crystal experts ready to demolish it, should they attempt to pass the canyon using the aqueduct."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5012!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But Khlutt is as crafty as he is pernicious... It's only a matter of time before he finds a way across to massacre every living being on this side of the canyon!"

A.response_text: "And what did you do to spark his ire?"

D.response_text: "What power do you possess that the Tacribians covet!?"

E.response_text: "And why should I help you?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.601!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes, well you see, the Tacribian... gremlin-men... covet control of our ancient Wellspring."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "And their gremlin-mage is a vile abomination named Khlutt."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "While currently the Gate of Celestial Judgment prevents them from assaulting us, Khlutt is surely scheming a way to circumvent this obstacle."

F.response_text: "Strange... Why covet water when Gremlins spurn baths and cleanliness..?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.102!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Well, you understand, our ancient Wellspring is not merely a holy site!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "In fact, it serves as a reservoir, sustaining all the townships of this land."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, through no fault of our own, the Wellspring has become defiled..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1022!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You see, deadly creatures now stalk its halls, water has ceased to flow to Tacriba, and the entrance has been sealed, leaving the Farcaster inside as the only point of access..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1023!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Which is where you come in, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1024!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "The Farcaster Glyph has been lost since the Punishing Wars devastated Kabu a thousand some aught years ago. No records of its use or even any mention of its existence remain, save the seals themselves..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1025!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yet a Farcaster user now stands before me - a gift from Biracul for my righteousness, no doubt."

A.response_text: "No water? The Tacribians sound justified in their grievance."

E.response_text: "Perhaps I should help your enemies; they, at least, sound competent."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.202!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It's the sacred charge of Dazir to be the custodians of the ruins left behind by the ancient Vanquished - the greatest among them being a Wellspring dedicated to the Water Spirits."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But now, the ancient site has sealed its entrance to us and the only way to access it is through the use of a Farcaster."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Your task would be to enter and cleanse this ancient ruin of the evil that haunts it - once completed, our ancient Archives would be entirely at your disposal, of course."

A.response_text: "I still don't understand why Tacriba would do this."

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.302!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I imagine you would be especially interested in the possibility of a death of thirst..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, the Tacribians seek to claim the Wellspring for themselves, knowing nothing of its operation!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Their betrayal of Biracul's order threatens the lives of all civilized folk in Kabu... including yourself."

B.response_text: "What would you want me to do?"

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

D.response_text: "If you were to share your knowledge, I might be able to help you..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.402!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "By being the guardians of ancient Vanquished ruins, we have learned much about the manipulation of the physical world; and the Tacribians have always been envious of us and our mastery."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, they seek to claim the Wellspring for themselves, while knowing nothing of its operation!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Clearly, their betrayal of Biracul's order threatens the lives of all civilized folk in Kabu."

C.response_text: "I think I had best remain neutral at this time."

D.response_text: "If you were to share your knowledge, I might be able to help you..."

E.response_text: "I admire ambition. Why should I not help your enemies?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As you may have ascertained, this war will decide the balance of power in the region."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5021!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Ally with us now, and you will have the gratitude of the future masters of Kabu!"

A.response_text: "What would you need me to do?"

D.response_text: "I'd be far more capable of success if you'd kindly provide me with some boon..."

E.response_text: "Only if you're victorious. Why shouldn't I just help your enemies?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6020!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, I should mention that the ancient Wellspring we maintain is not merely for water; in fact it contains many holy relics of the ancient Vanquished from before the Great Awakening."

F.response_text: "So, that's their game."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.103!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "They are, perhaps, but their thirst for violent reprisal will doom us all!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "If they succeed in their assault, then none will remain with knowledge of how to maintain the Wellspring or its aqueducts. Without us, no Kaban will have water!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Our destruction would seal the fate of all who dwell in Kabu, Dazirans and Tacribians alike."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now, I implore you! Use your Farcasting ability to help me to save both ourselves and our enemies!"

A.response_text: "I'll help you avert this catastrophe."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

E.response_text: "I need something more than promises for such an undertaking."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1033!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes, of course, allow me to explain. You see, the Wellspring is not merely a holy site; it also supplies water to the other townships."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1034!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, something has happened to disrupt the flow of water, sparking the ire of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1035!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "As you are the only living Farcaster user, you alone can enter the Wellspring's halls, cleanse the corruption and restore the passage of water to the Tacribian township."

A.response_text: "I'll help you avert this catastrophe."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

E.response_text: "Not at this time."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.203!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "The answer to this mystery has eluded us..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps an evil spirit awoke within, or perhaps a Tacribian saboteur engineered this incident to give a cause for their invasion - fools that they are by barring all from entry with their unbridled stupidity!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "What is certain, is that with the water flow restored, those boorish savages will have no reason to be as angry as the Amethyst Jinn any longer."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So I ask: will you help us to restore the water and avert a catastrophe?"

A.response_text: "I wish to see this Wellspring for myself; I accept your task."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure I'm prepared for such a dangerous venture."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.303!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now is the only time you have!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "My people don't have the luxury to wait for your 'ifs' or 'whethers'! We need your ability to Farcast immediately because our destruction is imminent!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Note that I will take any further delay as a refusal; so decide now what your course of action will be!"

D.response_text: "Then I accept, gracious Khaa."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I see that you mean to worm whatever secrets you can from me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But I suppose that makes you are a fitting weapon to use against my foes."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4032!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Very well, I shall grant you access to my township; whatever knowledge you find from my people is yours."

C.response_text: "I don't think this will be enough."

D.response_text: "Then I accept, gracious Khaa."

E.response_text: "I'll do it, but with such a humble boon I can promise little..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.503!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You are brave to act so boldly towards a mage in his own home... or perhaps merely truth-blind."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will assume the latter, and forgive your misspeech this time."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5031!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now listen carefully, Dazir is the sole inheritor of the relics and structures left by the Vanquished. If the Tacribians succeed in destroying us, you will never learn the secrets of our untold power!"

A.response_text: "Then I accept."

D.response_text: "Share some of this power with me and I can save your people."

E.response_text: "Why beg me for help if you are so powerful? Your lies sicken me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.603!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Yes! And the only way to stop the gremlin-men is to send the water back to the Dawn Fortress..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6030!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "So do you accept this quest? Will you use your unique ability to Farcast? Will you save our realm from the Gremlin Menace?!"

D.response_text: "Give me your hat and I'll think about it."

E.response_text: "Of course not! I'll deal with the gremlins my way!"

F.response_text: "Fear not, sweet Khaa; good will prevail!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.104!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "That you seek to righteously preserve innocent lives speaks very highly of your character, Eidos!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now listen closely for here is what you must do."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You will use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at the heart of which you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Open it and you will have our eternal love and gratitude."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1043!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Ah! But in order to manipulate the guardians within, as well as all other mechanisms, you'll likewise require this Sigil of Wulfias."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.204!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Only a true lover of wisdom could recognize the folly of those draug-witted Tacribians!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Together we can defend the sanctity of knowledge, but first listen to what you must do."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You will use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at the heart of which you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and our Archives will teach you many secrets of the hoary Vanquished!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2043!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, in order to do so, you'll likewise require this Sigil of Wulfias; together they will enable you to control all mechanisms within the Temple."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "My people do not have the luxury of waiting for you to master a lifetime of lore and knowledge!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But if you are so fearful, you may briefly speak with the learned folk of Dazir; their knowledge will help you."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though you are not to tarry long! Time is of the essence!"

A.response_text: "I'll go to the Wellspring without delay."

C.response_text: "I think I'll pass and just leave."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.404!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You have chosen wisely... Now pay close attention!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I will give you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4042!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "You're as guileful as the Ruby Jinn himself..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4045!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Though I should hardly expect more from a desert vagabond."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Very well, then you may briefly speak with the learned denizens of Dazir to help you prepare."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But first, pay close attention, to what I am about to say."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4048!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4049!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I will give you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40490!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5046!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Use the Farcaster to access the Wellspring, at its heart you'll find a gate that impedes the flow of water to the stronghold of the Tacribians."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5047!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Release the water and I shall gift you a suitable reward."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5048!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "However, you'll require the Sigil of Wulfias in order to control the mechanisms within the Wellspring itself."

F.response_text: "Sure thing, honey buns."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6040!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Also, take the Sigil of Wulfias to control the..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6041!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Well, you'll probably just destroy the crystal controlling the dam anyway... but just in case."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6044!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "No, but you may wander Dazir and help yourself to any hats you find lying around..."

F.response_text: "Deal!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!9.001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I will not allow someone so clearly hostile to roam about!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!9.0010!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "The consequences of your poor decisions are most heavy indeed, as I am sentencing you to permanent exile!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!9.0011!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Never again shall your foul shadow darken our doorstep."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!9.X100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Now allow me to show you the way to our Farcaster, that you may then hurry to fulfill your oath."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!11.X000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Well, have you made any progress in your mission?"

A.response_text: "I have not."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!11.X100!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "Then get back to work! The moment of reckoning draws ever-nearer and here you are dawdling about! Jinns take you, woman!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!19.000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "I don't know how you figured it out, but purifying the water truly means death for us."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!19.0000!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "That fool Pakahron will lower the barrier at the Gate of Celestial Judgment, leaving the path to Dazir without obstruction."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!19.0001!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "It will only be a matter of time before that fool Khlutt strikes and razes our townships."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!19.0002!KHAA!.dialogue_text: "But I will not go to the Graylands alone; my death demands your company!"

A.response_text: "Reap what you've sown, Khaa."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.001!RADA!.dialogue_text: "So, you're finally coming around... I feared we had lost you for good."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X0010!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Now, don't try to move just yet! Your time in the Jenowin Plain has fevered your blood and robbed your brain of water!"

A.response_text: DIP

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1010!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You should listen to old Rada; she's brought back many folk that have been jinnstruck on the plain, after all!"

A.response_text: "Thank you for saving my life."

E.response_text: "Explain what happened to me."

F.response_text: "Who is this 'Old Rada' you speak of? What does she wish to tell me?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3010!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Old Rada was able to get some fluid into your Falseflesh, but the sooner you whet your whistle, the sooner you will be able to recover!"

D.response_text: "Why did you help me?"

F.response_text: "Who is this 'Old Rada' you speak of? What does she wish to tell me?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.501!RADA!.dialogue_text: "I would tell you to be careful, but I doubt you'll pay any heed to old Rada."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5010!RADA!.dialogue_text: "It's probably this jinnloving willfulness that led you to all but die out on the plain!"

A.response_text: "Thank you for saving my life."

D.response_text: "Why did you help me?"

E.response_text: "Explain what happened."

F.response_text: "Who is this 'Old Rada' you speak of? What does she wish to tell me?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.601!RADA!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard! You must have entirely lost your wits out on the plain!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6010!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Old Rada has seen many a fool in the Jinns' embrace, but never one that clucked like a chicken!"

F.response_text: "I invoke the Caw because of my devotion to the Feathered One. 'Buck-awk!'"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.102!RADA!.dialogue_text: "I accept your thanks! But even as mere loremasters in the eyes of Biracul, what manner of people would Dazirans be if we didn't aid a sister in need?!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1020!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Tambul may be known for their courtesy, but they sure as Suyutis love goats don't have a monopoly on it!"

A.response_text: "Is there any way I can repay you?"

B.response_text: "What manner of lore have you mastered?"

E.response_text: "I'd like to depart now."

F.response_text: "True... but if anyone has a monopoly on 'badass', it's me."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.202!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You're in the township of Dazir, home of mountain wards and lorekeepers of the Wellspring!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2020!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Surely, your journey must have been to seek us... Or could it be, that you wandered here by accident?"

A.response_text: "Is there any way I can repay you?"

B.response_text: "What manner of lore have you mastered?"

C.response_text: "What is to become of me here?"

F.response_text: "I seek limp-wristed scholars in need of muscle. I seem to have found them!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X302!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Indeed! What provoked you to cross the Jenowin Plain? And without a waterskin!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3020!RADA!.dialogue_text: "We of Dazir know much of the lore of the land, and old Rada has never heard the like - it's straight out of one of the Wayfarer's adventures, I tell you."

B.response_text: "What manner of lore have you mastered?"

C.response_text: "There's little purpose to any of my actions."

D.response_text: "What is to become of me here?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3021!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Indeed! What provoked you to cross the Jenowin Plain? And without a waterskin!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3022!RADA!.dialogue_text: "We of Dazir know much of the lore of the land, and old Rada has never heard the like - it's straight out of one of the Wayfarer's adventures, I tell you."

B.response_text: "What manner of lore have you mastered?"

D.response_text: "Why did you save me?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.402!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Do we need a reason to come to the aid of a dying traveler? What do you take us for, Tacribian jinnworshipers?"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4020!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You must come from a harsh land indeed to find our hospitality surprising!"

D.response_text: "Now that I am healed, what do you intend to do?"

E.response_text: "If it's all the same to you, I'm going to leave now."

F.response_text: "I figured it was because you needed a hero. Don't worry, you've found one."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X502!RADA!.dialogue_text: "We found you outside the walls this morning - must've walked the whole night and collapsed at the entrance to our township."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5020!RADA!.dialogue_text: "When the guards brought you here, you were paler than a Muninn and writhing in the grips of a Jinn's embrace. And all through the night you had raving fits, muttering something of the other about that foreign mage, Mifas'cul!"

A.response_text: "Is there any way I can repay you?"

D.response_text: "Now that I'm healed, what do you intend to do?"

E.response_text: "I tire of this. I'm leaving."

F.response_text: "Replace 'collapse' with 'nap' and 'raving fits' with 'erotic dream' and you got it."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5021!RADA!.dialogue_text: "We found you outside the walls this morning - must've walked the whole night and collapsed at the entrance to our township."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5022!RADA!.dialogue_text: "When the guards brought you here, you were paler than a Muninn and writhing in the grips of a Jinn's embrace. And all through the night you had raving fits, muttering something of the other about that foreign mage, Mifas'cul!"

A.response_text: "Is there any way I can repay you?"

D.response_text: "I was attacked on the plain."

E.response_text: "I tire of this. I'm leaving."

F.response_text: "Replace 'collapse' with 'nap' and 'raving fits' with 'erotic dream' and you got it."
"So you're Rada... huh, I was beginning to think you were just a talking leather chair..."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.103!RADA!.dialogue_text: "In the words of Biracul, 'Kindness begets kindness'!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1030!RADA!.dialogue_text: "We Dazirans are in danger and have need of assistance - something Khaa, no doubt, would like to discuss this with you."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1031!RADA!.dialogue_text: "He’ll probably see my thoughts, but maybe I should go fetch him, just in case. You wait here, dear."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.203!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Oh my! Well, you'd be lying in this bed until the rain falls if I were to tell the whole of it! And my voice already fails me even at this hour."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2030!RADA!.dialogue_text: "But fear not, I'll go fetch our mage-leader, Khaa - he sure as Biracul is shining wants to speak with you."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3030!RADA!.dialogue_text: "But enough with our little chat; it's time you spoke with our mage-leader, Khaa!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3031!RADA!.dialogue_text: "He expressed much interest in you, young traveler. So I'll go tell him you're up."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3033!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You don't say? Praise be to Biracul that you yet live, foreigner!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3034!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You sure as Biracul is shining must've met a Jinn out in the desert!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3035!RADA!.dialogue_text: "They're known to lure the unwary off course and into a death of thirst!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3036!RADA!.dialogue_text: "But this is a discussion best left to you and our mage-leader. Let me go tell him you're awake."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.403!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, I'm afraid that's up for our mage-leader to decide!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.503!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, I'm afraid I must ask that you linger here a time longer - for your own sake as much as ours."

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5030!RADA!.dialogue_text: "You wouldn't survive another journey in your condition, and our mage-leader wanted to speak with you as soon as you woke up!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.603!RADA!.dialogue_text: "I see... Perhaps madness is the explanation for your jinnlickin' sojourn - pardon my language!"

KABU!DAZIR!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6030!RADA!.dialogue_text: "Khaa will want to speak to you for certain!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Walking past the temple, Eidos is greeted by stagnant air, rank with the perfume of sewage. This area is carved directly from the mountain itself, keeping it walled-in on all sides save for the one opening towards the temple and the atrium. Shadows are thicker than their counterparts here, as the second tier acts as an impenetrable roof, finishing of the containment for this forgotten and unwanted segment of Dazir. The architecture here likewise lacks the sophistication of the rest of the township, with the exception of several prodigious pillars used to support the unfathomable weight of the second tier. The most luxurious houses are half-collapsed edifices with tattered rags acting as curtains. All the doors have either rusted off their hinges or broken off until little in the way of wood is left.\n\n\t\tNot many people walk about in this place, most choosing to simply hug their shins while murmuring half-hearted lamentations. Those who have the energy to walk around seem to be at loose ends.

A.response_text: Approach people to talk

B.response_text: Return to the Atrium and the Temple

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: In the darkened, grimy streets it looks like many here keep to their own business - if pacing about aimlessly can be considered business. Some stumble about in an intoxicated state, while others stare at her with looks that are a noxious concoction of fear, lust and envy.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X0010!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: However, after enough searching, Eidos finds that even here there are some who are willing to talk.

A.response_text: A filthy street urchin

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.0011!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The stagnant air is thick with the smell of sewage, vomit and Jinn-Liquor. Whoozy from the stench, Eidos peers through the haze and spots the top of the Temple not far away. Off to the north part of the slums, Eidos sees what appears to be a gathering of the destitute denizens of the area.

A.response_text: Explore the northern slums

B.response_text: Return to the Atrium and the Temple

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X0012!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos approaches the crowd, but is too short to see over their heads. Thus, she performs an ill-advised attempt at acrobatics and leaps up onto a crumbling wall, which remains miraculously intact - perhaps the buildings here are tougher than they look. From this vantage point she can see a turquoise-robed woman addressing the crowd. Cocking her ear towards the speaker, Eidos focuses all her energy on deciphering what she is saying.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.0013!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Akara's final echoing words vanish, so too does the crowd. All now slink back to their crumbling abodes to lethargically gather their work gear. Of course, this means that Eidos too must now come down from her perch and... with that thought, the brick beneath her feet finally gives way, sending her gracelessly diving into a stack of empty crates.\n\n\t\tPicking herself up, she dusts off the debris and stands in place awkwardly wondering if anyone witnessed her fall.

A.response_text: Return to the Atrium and the Temple

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: In the darkened, grimy streets it looks like many here keep to their own business - if pacing about aimlessly can be considered business. Some stumble about in an intoxicated state, while others stare at her with looks that are a noxious concoction of fear, lust and envy.\n\n\t\tHowever, after enough searching, Eidos finds that even here there are some who are willing to talk.

A.response_text: A filthy street urchin

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.0020!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The stagnant air is thick with the smell of sewage, vomit and Jinn-Liquor. Whoozy from the stench, Eidos peers through the haze and spots the top of the Temple not far away. The once crowded northern slums appear as desolate as any other part of the area, as all the downtrodden denizens must be hard at work strengthening the town's fortifications.

A.response_text: Approach people to talk

B.response_text: Return to the Atrium and the Temple

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0099.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls into grime that coats everything in this filthy place, shouts from the Atrium herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.100!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.101!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.102!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.103!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.104!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.105!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!999.106!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.000!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "...and thus, citizens of the lowest tier! Lend your ears to the decree of your mage-leader!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.001!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "The impending assault of the savage illiterati from across the canyon weighs heavy upon our hearts! But we will do what we can to thwart their insidious efforts to eradicate the educated people of our homeland, for the glory of Dazir!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.002!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "Let it be known that venerable Khaa has ordered all able-bodied workers of the lowest tier to begin immediate enhancements to the walls of Dazir!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.003!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "A lengthy peace has left our barriers untested and inadequate. Therefore, upon your honor as workers of Dazir, you must ensure that we artisans can survive, that our mastery of Vanquished artifice will not vanish as the builders of our sacred Wellspring once did!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.004!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "As a reward for the two most industrious among you, venerable Khaa has decreed that one will be advanced to the rank of Master Foreman, overseer of all workers of this tier! The other will receive an artisan's education and move to live in the upper tier among peers!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.005!ARKARA!.dialogue_text: "Now, go! Gather your implements, your supplies and gumption! We will imbue the walls with the strength of Ark, that they may hold against this new threat from the wastes!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.000!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Hullo, foreigner! 'haps ya here to help us figh' the Tacribs?! They mean to invade us any day now!"

A.response_text: "I wish to help, but not through violence."

B.response_text: "What could one person do to stop an army?"

D.response_text: "Why should I?"

E.response_text: "Do you deserve to be helped?"

F.response_text: "I would, if I wasn't so busy fighting these damn gremlins!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.100!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Wha' else could we do? I heard tha' the Tacribs are closer to animals than men, tha' they be touch'ed by the Jinns frem their time walkin' the Was'es and would as soon kill ya if ya e'en look'ed their way!"

A.response_text: "There must be a way to reason with them."

E.response_text: "Then your people were fools to anger them."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.200!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul could! He'd blas' those barbarians to crumbs!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2000!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Did ya hear the story abou' wha' he did to Konki and Nerius, the twinned Jinns?!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2001!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "'Amythes' demon, yer time has come!' Ka-POW! Jus' like tha'!"

A.response_text: "I'm not sure if force is best met with force."

C.response_text: "Maybe he could... but he isn't here."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.300!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "I guess yer righ'. Biracul's jus' a hero in a stery anyway, ain' he?"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.400!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "We don' have much, bu we'll award ya anythin' if ya can help us!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.4000!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Ma paps has plen'y o' good tools, and I know ma mum would hand o'er her bes' stones!"

C.response_text: "Truthfully, I don't know how you could be helped."

D.response_text: "Ha! Don't worry child. I'll give you all the help you deserve..."

E.response_text: "Plague me not with your baubles, boy. I'll help you... if it suits me."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.500!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Please! Ya have to! We've ne'er hur' anybody!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.5000!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "And the old folk say the warriors of the Dawn Fertress are goin' to harm us!"

A.response_text: "Then I'll try to speak with them about it."

D.response_text: "Let me consider the matter..."

E.response_text: "No one is innocent, boy! Think on the sins of your people; your time is short."

F.response_text: "Well they're realer than you and me, kid!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.6001!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "They say the trickster Famlaz could raise 'em up frem the ground to steal kids!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.6002!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Bu' Biracul saved the kids and ran 'em monsters away... Don' tell me they're comin' back?!"

E.response_text: "Indeed they are boy, and Biracul won't be here to save you this time..."

F.response_text: "Count on it! It's as certain as your imminent doom!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.1010!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "I hope there's a way to convince 'em no' to kill us; don' wanna lose ma family!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X1011!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "I sure wish Khaa were as strong as Ark, then we wouldn' ha'e to worry abou' the Tacribs."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.201!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul was the mage who buil' Dazir!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2010!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "They say he couldn' die, tha' he wen' into the Was'es, but tha' he'll also come back some day!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2011!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Don' ya pray to Biracul in yer hometown? Oh yeah! I should go to the temple an' pray!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.301!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "I guess yer righ'... Biracul's jus' a hero in a stery anyway, ain't he?"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.3011!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "I guess yer righ'... 'Tis hopeless, like ma paps says."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X401!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Gosh miss, I hope ya can help us!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X501!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Whaaaaaaa! Mum, this bad lady is puttin' the jinnfear in me!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.X601!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Sure thin'! Thanks fer yer help, fereigner!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!1.X000!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: " 'Biracul, Biracul, keep me frem the Jinn's influen...za."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!1.X001!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul, Biracul, lead me to the path of righ...ches'nu's."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!1.X002!COZKUIN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul, Biracul, may you...' ah, I ferget the res'."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "No' tryin' to speak with Famlaz's tongue, bu' I wish tha' ma job gave me a house in the middle tier."

A.response_text: "Tell me more about your position in society."

C.response_text: "I imagine most people feel this way."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can help you... for a price."

E.response_text: "Wishing for a thing does not make it so."

F.response_text: "No, you don't!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.100!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I'm a stone worker, a skilled profession, in the grand scheme o' thin's. Biracul be praised, I'm no lowly farmer er a draug-brained Tacrib."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.1000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Bu' I'm no' so skilled as the artisans who li'e in Dazir's middle tier."

A.response_text: "But aren't your skills just as important as theirs?"

B.response_text: "Who judged this to be the best method of organizing society?"

E.response_text: "Strength is the only necessary skill."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.200!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I understand yer a sa'age frem the deser' and ya don' understand how ci'ilized people work. Bu' here in Dazir, folk are gif'ed the stuff they should ge' with their hard work and their own contributions to the town."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "'Course, the artisans li'e abo'e the rest of us, being tha' they ha'e the bigges' skill o' all Kaban workers."

A.response_text: "What is it that makes you less important than them?"

B.response_text: "Who judged this to be the best method of organizing society?"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.300!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I understand yer a sa'age frem the deser' and ya don' understand how ci'ilized people work. Bu' here in Dazir, folk are gif'ed the stuff they should ge' with their hard work and their own contributions to the town."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.3000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Course, the artisans li'e abo'e the res' o' us, being tha' they ha'e the bigges' skill of all Kaban workers."

B.response_text: "Who judged this to be the best method of organizing society?"

D.response_text: "If you have any useful information, I could speak highly of you to my friend Khaa..."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.400!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Wha'? Wha' 'tis ya mean to do? How could a sa'age like ya help me?"

C.response_text: "If you don't want my help, why are you complaining?"

D.response_text: "I have Khaa's ear... Tell me something useful, and I'll see to it you're rewarded."

E.response_text: "The doors of opportunity are unlocked with the keys of strength."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.5000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Bu' I'm only a stone worker. How can I climb the ranks withou' the higher learnin' o' the artisans?"

A.response_text: "Why does being an artisan make one superior?"

D.response_text: "I have Khaa's ear. Tell me something useful and I might help you."

E.response_text: "The doors of opportunity are unlocked with the keys of strength."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.600!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "...Ya know wha', I s'pose yer righ'!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.6000!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "When ya think abou' i', ma place is as a stone worker; I'm essential!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.6001!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Jus' as we Dazirans are abo'e the Tambulans and Tacribs, so too are the artisans abo'e me."

F.response_text: "No they're not."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.101!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "'Tis clear as Biracul is shinin' tha' the artisans are be'er 'cause o' their learnin'!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.1010!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I should no've was'ed ma time tryin' to bring sigh' to a blind fereigner like ya."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.201!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Biracul likely said i' was to be so a long time ago."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.2010!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Bu', who cares?! The ways o' the good are clear as Biracul is shinin' to good, hones' folk - doub' a Suyu'i goa'lo'er such as ya'll e'er understand."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.301!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I told ya, I'm no' complainin'! I'm jus' wonderin' aloud!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.3010!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Ne'er mind, fereigner. I'm finish'ed talkin' with ya!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.401!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Oh, ya could? Wull, in tha' case... I did see somethin' unusual recen'ly..."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.4010!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Our Librarian, Quan'jo, has gone missin'... No'ne knows where he is, bu' I saw him wanderin' abou' on the path to the Valley o' Bones down in the Crescen' Canyon near Tambul; 'haps he can be found there..."

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.4011!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "I would apprecia' wha'e'er word ya can pu' in fer me to Khaa!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.501!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "So ya think I should strong-arm my betters?"
