KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!0.5010!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "If I wan'ed the advice o' a blood-crazed sa'age, I would aks a Tacrib!"

A.response_text: "No I don't! Hey this is fun, say something else!"

KABU!DAZIR!THE SHADES!1.001!GALIP!.dialogue_text: "Please don' ferget to tell Khaa abou' lil' ol' Galip! Biracul be with ya!"

F.response_text: "No '...' didn't! Ha ha! Roostor be praised!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Walking through the haze of sacrificial smoke, Eidos enters the dim light of the Temple. While there are some narrow windows up high, the light without is too weak to illuminate the space within. Thus, hundreds of candles light numerous shrines in the wings of the complex, however, the central area is bathed in a cool blue light. At the center of this structure is a gushing fountain, with a thousand points of glittering light shining from the stone beneath the water.\n\n\t\tAll people in this site are silent as they approach the font. They prostrate themselves before it, mouth incantations and collect water in their vessels. Whatever is said in these whispering moments is drowned out by the sound of flowing water and remains unheard. The citizenry here seem utterly focused on their water-fetching efforts and one figure alone seems approachable: a man dressed in golden robes - clearly reciprocating a desire to speak, as he now stares intently at Eidos.

A.response_text: Approach the golden-robed figure

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X001!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos gently shoves her way through the crowd, eventually arriving to where the golden-robed man eagerly awaits.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: The conversation with the cleric at its end, Eidos now stands in the Temple of Biracul deciding upon her next course of action.

A.response_text: Approach Aydin again

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0099.000!DE.dialogue_text: As her victim's last breath floats up with the smoke of the burning incense, Eidos can hear shouts from the Slums outside. Soon the lithe figure of Khaa, the mage of Dazir, steps withing the darkened, smoky atmosphere of the Temple. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.X000!DE.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.001!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.100!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.101!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.102!DES.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.103!DES.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.104!DES.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.105!DES.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.106!DES.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.001!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Did you come here to pray to the Shining One, child?"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.002!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Please, join us; for the end is near!"

A.response_text: "Are things really so hopeless for your people?"

B.response_text: "Could you tell me more of this 'Shining One'?"

D.response_text: "What's to be gained through prayer?"

E.response_text: "So you're a superstitious lot, praying to fairy tale heroes?"

F.response_text: "I pray to Roostor! May his merciful caw sound for you this day."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.100!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Do you not know? The brutish illiterati of the Dawn Fortress mean to wage war upon us, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Naturally, Biracul proscribed against such violence, but the wasteland-dwellers broke this covenant long ago when they built the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1001!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Now, there can be no salvation for such reckless destruction."

A.response_text: "There are always options; despair profits us nothing."

B.response_text: "What would Biracul tell you to do?"

E.response_text: "When met with violence, I respond in kind. Behold, I still live."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.200!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "You mean to say you have never heard of Biracul? The Shining One? the First Mage?!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "He used his Techne to protect our ancestors from the Jinns of the Wastes and from the Prismatic Jinns!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2001!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Why, he gave us all our laws and commanded us to abandon all ways of wickedness - amethyst, ruby, emerald and obsidian alike!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2002!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Yet the Tacribians have now abandoned his path - returning to the worship of the Amethyst and Obsidian Jinns - and the dream of our lives will soon be over..."

A.response_text: "Despair profits us nothing; we must seek solutions!"

B.response_text: "What would Biracul tell you to do?"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.300!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "You're welcome to stay here and prepare for the end."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.400!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Insight. Acceptance. Peace. Biracul taught us the methods of meditation and introspection, so that we might find some modicum of serenity in a world of hatred and strife."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.4000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "By refusing to become a part of savagery, by embracing the collective needs of the brotherhood of man, we can transcend our corrupt materiality."

C.response_text: "Perhaps it is so. I'll leave you to your meditation, then."

D.response_text: "Serenity is a poor shield against spears..."

E.response_text: "In other words, he taught you to surrender like cowards."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.500!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Could superstition have raised the walls you see around you?"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Or could mere flights of fancy provide our bodies and souls with the nourishment that sustains them?"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5005!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Jinnborn illusions the traitorous Tacribians have come to believe are real!"

A.response_text: "I doubt Dazir could've been wrought by folk so willing to accept destruction."

D.response_text: "Philosophy is a poor shield against spears..."

E.response_text: "Oh? Well, your reality is about to be shattered by an illusion."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.600!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "I... um... have never heard of such a deity."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.6000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Here in Kabu, Biracul's teachings protect us; do Roostor's do the same?"

C.response_text: "I feel unwell. Forgive me, I must depart."

E.response_text: "Oh? Word on the street is Dazir's soon to be a Tacribian-smoked graveyard."

F.response_text: "Judge for yourself: 'Bok-bok-bok... BUCK-KAWWW!'"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.101!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "You speak the words of Biracul as though you had studied them in earnest."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1010!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Perhaps his teachings are innate... Or perhaps he now speaks through you..."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1011!AYDI.dialogue_text: "You have given me much to think on, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X1012!AYD.dialogue_text: "May the Shining One light your path."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.201!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "He would implore us to seek refuge in the company and thoughts of our fellow man."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2010!AYDI.dialogue_text: "When we commune with our brothers in quiet contemplation, we will understand that death is not the end."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.301!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Farewell, foreigner. Remember, that whatever pain befalls the corporeal, it is merely a vessel and harms not your Trueflesh!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.401!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "You have heard my words, but you have not listened!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.4010!AYDI.dialogue_text: "We protect ourselves not from pain or death of the Falseflesh, but from wickedness and corruption of the true!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.4011!AYDI.dialogue_text: "'Give evil nothing to oppose and it will destroy itself.'"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.501!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "Mock us if you wish, foreigner; you will never understand that the walls protecting us are not made from rigid stone, but from the lithe wisdom of the Shining One!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5010!AYDI.dialogue_text: "We stand on the threshold of the infinite, outsider. Can you say the same?"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5012!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Then you stand before us a Trueflesh under a jinncast shadow!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5013!AYDI.dialogue_text: "You would have us abandon the path Biracul, have us walk in the steps of the Amethyst Jinn; but to do that, would be to truly die!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5015!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Biracul will guide us into the Graylands to meet Ark, Kambesh and his myriad devotees!"

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.601!AYDIN.dialogue_text: "I... see... Well, at least it sounds more constructive than that Prophet who comes and goes."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X6010!AYD.dialogue_text: "So, 'Bok-Bok-Buckaw' to you too, outsider; and may the Shining One light your path."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X000!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Biracul, Biracul, keep me from the Jinns' influence.\n\t\tBiracul, Biracul, lead me to the path of righteous.\n\t\tBiracul, Biracul, may you illuminate our way, as you did with Ark against Rikharr."

KABU!DAZIR!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X001!AYDI.dialogue_text: "Unity above all else unto the singularity,\n\t\tthat we may see in others ourselves,\n\t\tand reach ever closer to Conscientia!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Grinding wheels, saws, drills, and hammers all work away at stone, wood, metal and glass. Clinking and buzzing. Cracking and snapping. The bizarre percussive symphony moves along at a hypnotic tempo, lulling the worker spirit into a frenzy. As music would make a person want to dance, so too does this instrumental make Eidos want to work. It takes a great force of will to stop herself from rolling up her sleeves and joining in the industrial bacchanal.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking around, Eidos notes that while some implements are wielded manually, larger equipment is compelled by driving wheels and complex gear arrangements, themselves turned by water spouting from numerous, variably-pressured fonts in the upper walls. Other rarer items seem to be crystal-driven and also seem to be the most frighteningly powerful among the tools.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The entire area is abuzz with activity. Scores of people are in equal measure discussing, reading, crafting, and drafting. All wear clothing marked by distinctive turquoise accents - some even don frocks turquoise in their entirety.

A.response_text: Use the cloudstone

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: While most of the folk here are hard at work, closer inspection reveals that a distinction exists between those wearing turquoise merely as arm bands and those in similarly colored robes: the former perform the hard labor; whereas, the latter appear to have a more supervisory role.\n\n\t\tTwo among the crowd seem to be at loose ends, and as such, free to exchange words with Eidos.

A.response_text: Talk to the sharp-looking yet restless fellow

C.response_text: Talk to the elderly chap with a long white beard

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Having survived the conversation, Eidos scans the area, noting that most folk here are still completely absorbed in their work. Despite her unexplained presence, none seem to take much interest in her. The cloudstone that serves as an access point to other levels is accessible from this room. However, there are evidently more areas on this level to explore outdoors.

A.response_text: Use the cloudstone

C.response_text: Look for people to speak to

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0099.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls to the dusty Workshop floor, the cloudstone Lift drops from the area above, heralding the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!999.102!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!999.103!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!999.104!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!999.105!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!999.106!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "If you're wondering what an impressive artisan such as myself is doing with an abundance of leisure time, then I assure you I haven't been cursed by the despondent touch of the Obsidian Jinn..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X0002!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "For you see, I've good reason to be vexed by my idleness!"

E.response_text: "You're aggravating me already. I'm out."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0003!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Though I am an expert in Vanquished crystalline artifice, ever since our expulsion from the Wellspring I've been prevented from my customary metier."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0004!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "As I'm sure you can imagine, I've had more than my fair share of respite!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0005!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "But, I fear that my fellows may mistake such unindustrious behavior with torpescence!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.0006!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Thus, I can ill afford to stare idly at the four walls any longer!"

A.response_text: "What is it you normally do for Dazir?"

B.response_text: "Can you describe the nature of crystals to me?"

D.response_text: "I gather the crystals do nothing to protect you then..."

E.response_text: "Are all artisans so useless without their toys?"

F.response_text: "Four walls are comforting, especially when they're padded for safety!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.100!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Crystal authorities, such as myself, are charged with identifying various minerals, both naturally-occurring and of Vanquished make!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "It's we who determine their use for the good of the township, or their preservation for the use of future generations... For example, you can thank my predecessors for the cloudstone lift that brought you here!"

A.response_text: "How are crystals used by your community?"

B.response_text: "So what is it these crystals do?"

E.response_text: "What use are they to me?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.200!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "You can determine much of a gem's occult nature by its outward hue or dimensions! For instance, violet hexahedra often have the capacity to apply forces, while amber tetrahedra call forth beings from the Graylands."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.2000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Red octohedra contain ancient records or memories; whereas, black dodecahedra act as windows for viewing faraway objects. And if you see an inert one, it means it has been drained of actual - though perhaps not potential! - essence!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.2001!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "There are all sorts of other crystals and detailing their uses in even a cursory manner would require years of scholarship... It's no simple task, I assure you!"

A.response_text: "So how are they used here in Dazir?"

B.response_text: "What kind of knowledge is contained within these red crystals?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.300!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Ha! Perhaps it isn't... that is, if you intend to live out in the Wasteland like a jinnlicking Unseen! Pardon the language."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.3000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "But by Biracul's beard! The use of tools is what separates man from beasts - and what are crystals but the most powerful tool of all?"

A.response_text: "How are crystals used by your community?"

B.response_text: "So what is it these crystals do?"

C.response_text: "I'll bear this in mind, but I mean to avoid them as much as possible."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.400!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "You're about as correct in that assumption as a Jinnwraith is harmless!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "If you doubt me, then travel to Tambul and see the marvel that is the gate leading to the Dawn Fortress..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4002!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Truth be told and the words of Famlaz scorned! The protection proffered by that very gate is one of the only obstacles keeping Khlutt and his illiterati from assaulting Dazir at the moment..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4003!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Furthermore, Rashak, of the 'unhinged jaw' - called thus because he talks too much, ho ho! - theorizes that it might be possible to imbue spent crystals with new energy... But then again, he lacks the restraint of thought and humility of words for which I am acclaimed among my peers."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4004!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Though, if one were to do this, who knows what could be achieved..? A mage might well be able to put such a power to some use, perfidious or otherwise!"

C.response_text: "I'll bear this in mind, but I mean to avoid them as much as possible."

D.response_text: "Where is this Rashak?"

E.response_text: "What do you mean? How could crystals increase my strength?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.500!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Only a fool would think a human is stronger without their tools! Artifice is the sole arbiter of what separates man from beasts!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.5000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "And you would do well to regard the potential of crystals... They were contrived by the Vanquished and could be used to effect great help or harm!"

A.response_text: "How are crystals used by your community?"

D.response_text: "What threat do crystals pose to me?"

E.response_text: "What do you mean? How could crystals help me?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.600!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "So you have a history of madness..?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.6000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "If only I had the abilities of a Somatechnician, I would attempt to determine the cause!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.6001!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Even still! I imagine my unparalleled crystal lore could be of use to one as impaired as yourself..!"

C.response_text: "I'd prefer to stay far away from crystals..."

E.response_text: "What do you mean? How could crystals help me?"

F.response_text: "Do I detect a marriage proposal?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X101!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "We use violet crystals to create lifts and bridges. The red crystals are simply preserved for their ancient records. Any white crystal would be used by the Archives of a given township to shape the growth of the Muninn Trees! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.201!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Of that I know precious little! The content is often quite hoary and antiquated - as the method of recording thoughts into them has been lost - thus, only specialists in the Script of Vanargand can decipher most texts - enter the magi of our townships!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X2010!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "For you see, only the mage-leaders and their Librarians have knowledge of this orthographic marvel, so unless you can find one willing to teach you, they are as legible as ol' Famlaz is truthful! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.301!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Then you had best go into the very darkest depths of the Wasteland, outsider!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X3010!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "For crystals hold no power out there... Yes, not even Techne can work beyond the Dawn Fortress, they say, and venture any further in and humans lose the light of their very own mind-crystals..! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.3011!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Certainly! Why in the recent excavations at the Wellspring, we had discovered black tetrahedrons and blue orbs!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.3012!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "This notwithstanding, we had yet to discover their purposes before we were driven out!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.3013!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Though some of the menial workers claimed to have heard voices from some unseen source when around the blue sphere - but what can we expect other than superstitious murmurings from the less educated?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X3014!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "There are also accounts of green crystals whose form could be affected by attuned minds, but they have never been observed in the wild - that is, unless the hypothesis regarding Archmage Ark's ghelblade Luin and its origin proves true... but it's impossible to confirm! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.401!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunately for those of us who value a quiet workspace, he is right over there near the lift!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4010!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Speak to him at the risk of your sanity, his words are as his knowledge: endless..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X4011!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Though he may be older than Biracul and repeats himself more than a defective Neverborn, he is indeed among the greatest crystal masters in Daziran history! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.4012!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "The yellow prisms call forth ethereal beings into our world, to defend sacred and inviolable sites - such as our very own Wellspring! - from invaders!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X4013!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Take care to keep your distance from them or you're in for a one-way voyage to the Graylands, courtesy the Obsidian Jinn! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.501!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "There is an animus within the crystals that gives them their capabilities, a force seemingly compatible with life..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.5010!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Thus it stands to reason it could be absorbed, given the right tools or Techne."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X5011!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "I couldn't say what the effects would be, as it is entirely theoretical at this point! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.5012!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "There is an animus within the crystals that gives them their capabilities, a force seemingly compatible with life..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.5013!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Thus it stands to reason it could be absorbed, given the right tools or Techne."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.5014!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Moreover! The fact that crystals seem imbued with Technocraftic skill, seems to suggest an analog between them and the minds of magi..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X5015!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "It follows, then, that perhaps a mind could be healed - or, dare I say, augmented! - using crystals! Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X601!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Um, no, I should think not... Hmm..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.000!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Oh, wait! I nearly forgot to mention a critical detail!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.001!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "This is a basic understanding even among the basics, but you seem like enough of a dullard to not know that charged crystals - as in, not inert ones - do not take kindly to violence!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.002!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Though they are of 'robust' design, crack the outer casing and the energy within will be released to devastating effect!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.003!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Treat them with respect and tender loving care, however, and you can achieve feats to rival the hoary Vanquished! Blasphemy! Ho ho!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.004!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "Now leave me to my musings on crystals, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!1.X005!BEHIYE!.dialogue_text: "May Biracul's crystalline glow illuminate your path!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.000!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Well now! Who is it that enters the domain of Rashak the Old, Chief of the Crystal Custodians, Most Learned of Lucent Loremasters, Miester of Minerals, Chairman of the Guild of Artisans for the Preservation and Conservation of Energy?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.001!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "A foreigner, it seems... Could it be that you've heard of Rashak's Learned Lore?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X004!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Few magi could even profess to keep the knowledge I have gained in a lifetime of hands on experience; my fame is indisputable. But where did you hear of my expertise?"

A.response_text: "To be honest, I've never heard of you."

B.response_text: "Am I to understand you're a specialist in ancient crystals?"

D.response_text: "Oh Rashak, your learning is known far and wide!"

E.response_text: "What're you babbling about?"

F.response_text: "...I'm sorry I wasn't listening."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1000!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "You must have read one of my innumerable and invaluable tomes!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1001!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Yes, but there's so much I had to omit - so as not to confuse the layman, of course."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X1002!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "For instance, it is known that crystals cannot be repaired once broken - the knowledge is long lost, yes yes yes - but did you know that there's evidence of crystalline transmutation in reactive materials adjacent to energy crystals over time?"

A.response_text: "Sorry, none of this rings any bells - though I may have a memory problem."

C.response_text: "Fascinating... but I must be going now..."

D.response_text: "I see. Can this be used to harness some great power?"

E.response_text: "I tire of your senseless prattle. I'm leaving."

F.response_text: "Crystals..? I bet your house has the tackiest decor..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.101!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "And there is evidence that such new structures shared similar characteristics to the ones that spawned them..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1010!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "You know what this implies, don't you?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1011!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "But how could you possibly understand? For you are not me!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1012!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Let me explain it in a fashion such that even the illiterati could understand - for bringing sight to the truth-blind is but one of my myriad virtues."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1013!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "It means there must be a way of using energy to recreate crystal structures!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1014!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "I'm sure it was rather elementary for the Vanquished of course..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1015!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "If we could discover this lost knowledge, broken crystals could be reformed!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.X1016!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "It's all a matter of finding the lost techniques!"

A.response_text: "Are you even listening to me?"

B.response_text: "Any ideas where this knowledge could be hidden?"

D.response_text: "And this is important because...?"

E.response_text: "OK, I've had enough of this nonsense! I'm out!"

F.response_text: "Have you got a spare pair of heels? What am I asking, of course you do!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.102!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "And this is to say nothing of the possibilities for energy regeneration!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1020!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Let's posit - as I detailed in the Crystal Custodian Memorandum from three years ago - that it is beyond question that some hidden force within the Wellspring drains the crystals of their energy periodically.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1021!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Elementary laws of energy conservation as outlined by the Vanquished states that this energy must have gone somewhere."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1022!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Now most crystal custodians have been concerned with why this is happening."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1023!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "And while the cause has yet to be determined, the fact that it is happening is indubitably significant."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1025!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "But is it not as clear as the Shining One is sacred?!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1026!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "If there's a way to drain the crystals, there must be a way to UNdrain them!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1027!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Think of it: with the proper apparatus, a kitchen oven, a water wheel, or even the heat from a human body could be converted into crystalline energy!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1028!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "I'm working on the designs for a pair of thermal underwear that could convert the energy from one's frothy loins into a new form of salt crystal."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1030!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "Sure, there is wild speculation about its crippling effects on one's fertility."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP!0.1031!RASHAK!.dialogue_text: "But it's like I detailed in the Crystal Custodian Memorandum from seven years ago: monumental achievements require monumental sacrifices!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The heat outside the workshop is unbearable. A completely shadowless junkyard, this area appears to serve as a repository for excess materials. Piles of stone and wood litter the cobblestone floor, while great stacks of spooled twine are nestled firmly up against the workshop's walls. Set apart from all miscellany, however, is a great lattice of crystals.\n\n\t\tWhat at first appears to be the blinding reflection from the sun's unforgiving rays instead reveals itself to be the radiant energy housed within the crystals themselves. So bright, so resplendent are they, that Eidos cannot help but avert her tear-filled eyes from them. This lattice appears to be of great importance as it is both isolated from all other areas and boasts a contingent of nearly thirty guards around the perimeter.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: A great number of turquoise-robed people mill about the place, ordering others about with grand gestures and stern faces. Those commanded wear heavy work aprons with turquoise bands tied around their upper arms. Mindlessly they obey all orders, moving with a practiced efficiency well beyond the ordinary. Perfectly tuned, well-oiled cogs, they each perform their part flawlessly, giving life to the machinery of Dazir.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: At the eastern edge of the junkyard, is a banister overlooking the Jenowin Plain. Several of the aproned workers appear to linger there, taking a rest from their back-breaking labor.\n\n\t\tFurther north into town is a large plaza, speckled with thick, stone columns jutting out from the floor like the quills of a giant, rocky porcupine. At the center of the plaza is a decadent fountain of massive proportions, towering over the tops of the columns, reaching nearly to the topmost tier of the township.

A.response_text: Enter the Workshop

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: At Eidos' approach, the only worker who looks receptive to conversation, as all others continue their absent gaze out into the nothingness of the desert.

A.response_text: Speak to the smirking man with a dusty apron

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Cetin turns from Eidos to stare out into the distance at the shiny silver spire, leaving no doubt that the conversation has ended. Eidos the scans the area anew recalling that she can easily reach both the plaza and the workshop from this location.

A.response_text: Enter the Workshop

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0099.000!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos' victim falls to the tiles of the plaza floor, shouts from the Workshop herald the arrival of Khaa, mage of Dazir. His steely eyes stare down an aquiline nose at Eidos, like a raptor locking onto its prey. His face grows paradoxically more relaxed in the cruel scowl that gradually contorts his features, like old leather returning to a comfortable shape.\n\n\t\tConfidently, he strides towards her, not even a hint of surprise in his demeanor - this recent death clearly is no news to him. Without even a speck of wastefulness, of time and of movement alike, Khaa's thin frame draws up like a mantis poised to strike...

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.X000!DE.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.001!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Khaa in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.100!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.101!DES.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.102!DES.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.103!DES.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.104!DES.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.105!DES.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!999.106!DES.dialogue_text: "Her malefactors look down at her, smug yet uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, though their pride keeps it from their faces. Then..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.000!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Hail, outsider. I assume you've met with Khaa, our mage-leader, but do you understand the reason for such interrogations?"

A.response_text: "I understand it was necessary for him to understand my intentions."

B.response_text: "Perhaps. Does he always demand a meeting with visitors?"

D.response_text: "Of course. Your leader and I are old friends."

E.response_text: "Whatever the reason, it's no concern of yours."

F.response_text: "I don't know what you're implying, but I'm not that kind of girl!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.100!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Ah, but more than that, it is necessary to know that the Eye can see through you!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.1000!CETI.dialogue_text: "I don't know if Biracul ever appeared to your folk, but long ago, he clarified our sight such that we would know the Trueflesh."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.1001!CETI.dialogue_text: "Those who transgress the laws of Biracul - who violate the peace of the One! - are blinded to the Eye, untouchable by the Technocrafts. Those Unseen to the Eye are pariah, lacking in Trueflesh, blind even when basking the light of Awareness."

A.response_text: "What becomes of such people?"

B.response_text: "How is it that some minds are resistant to Techne?"

E.response_text: "You're a cowardly township indeed, to see enemies at every turn."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.200!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Of course! How else can we protect ourselves from the corrupted monsters whose minds are too twisted for the Technocrafts of a mage to behold?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.2000!CETI.dialogue_text: "There's no place in civilization for such half-men!"

A.response_text: "What becomes of such people?"

B.response_text: "How is it that some minds are resistant to Techne?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.300!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Indeed, he did. You could have been one of the Unseen!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.3000!CETI.dialogue_text: "Surely you know of the accursed Unseen, whose warped minds cannot be subjected to the mystic eye of Truesight?"

B.response_text: "Not entirely. How is it that some minds are resistant to Techne?"

D.response_text: "Of course I know of them, and despise them as much as you..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.400!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Ha! Though Khaa does keep the council of some foreigners, I doubt any so great as Khaa would be friends with a vagrant like you."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.4000!CETI.dialogue_text: "It's far more likely he wished to ensure that you were no jinncursed Unseen come to escape punishment - or else, a jinnspawn of Rikharr come to slay us with his mind-venom!"

D.response_text: "You wrong me to say that I'm anything akin to those freaks!"

E.response_text: "You're a paranoid township indeed, to see enemies at every turn."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.5000!CETI.dialogue_text: "In fact, it would concern all of us if you walked among us as one of the accursed Unseen."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.5001!CETI.dialogue_text: "There's no place in Dazir for such abominations as the followers of the Jinnwraith!"

A.response_text: "What becomes of such abominations?"

D.response_text: "You wrong me to say that I'm anything akin to those freaks!"

E.response_text: "You're a paranoid township indeed, to see enemies at every turn."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.6000!CETI.dialogue_text: "That's not what I meant; I merely wished to say that we have to make sure a mage can enter your mind..."

F.response_text: "Oh, I understand! And no mage is entering me, you dirty old man!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.101!CETIN.dialogue_text: "The Unseen are criminals, murderers and other such enemies of civilization."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.1010!CETI.dialogue_text: "As the highest form of punishment for their crimes, they're forced to drink the pitch black blood of a draug and then are cast out into the desert, forbidden from ever returning."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X1011!CET.dialogue_text: "Aberrations of nature are best absorbed back into nature."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.201!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Obviously because they strayed from the path of Biracul!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.2010!CETI.dialogue_text: "Unity is our gift and their punishment is isolation from our unity."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.2011!CETI.dialogue_text: "But civilization will always have enemies, enemies such as the Unseen who cannot live within society!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X2012!CET.dialogue_text: "No, Only gods and monsters can live outside of the city, and the Unseen are no gods!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X3010!CET.dialogue_text: "Any you meet that cannot be touched by Truesight are Unseen and are best avoided... or destroyed."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.401!CETIN.dialogue_text: "And hate them you should, foreigner, but you must understand our prudence."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.4010!CETI.dialogue_text: "Like those wretched followers of Kambesh, we must exile the unharmonious dregs of society."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X4011!CET.dialogue_text: "May you walk in the light of the Shining One, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.501!CETIN.dialogue_text: "You would think us cowardly and paranoid, but we have every right to be!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.5010!CETI.dialogue_text: "Biracul taught us long ago to integrate with one another, and seek communion with those in our township through the mage."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.5011!CETI.dialogue_text: "What else is a being whose mind cannot be guided and influenced by the community other than a threat to our peaceful way of life?"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X5012!CET.dialogue_text: "Be on your guard against the Unseen, foreigner."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.601!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Wait! No! That's not what I was saying!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X6011!CET.dialogue_text: "Ahem... Excuse me, I cannot talk to you anymore."

F.response_text: "Perverts are never the 'talking' type! Hey, everybody! This guy is a perv!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X102!CETI.dialogue_text: "Keep an eye out for potential Unseen, foreigner; and stay far away from the Wastelands east of the Dawn Fortress, lest you run into the only thing worse than an Unseen! A draugified Unseen!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.402!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Keep an eye out for potential Unseen, foreigner!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.X502!CETI.dialogue_text: "You've already been warned about the Unseen, now off you go."

F.response_text: "You're still here?! Help! I need an adult!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!0.900!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Pay her no mind, Cetin; pay her no mind..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.000!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Wait a moment, you must be the foreigner who is to traverse the legendary Wellspring - the source of much of our acclaim and envy."

A.response_text: "Yes, I'm interested in helping you."

B.response_text: "I wish to uncover what's going on in there."

D.response_text: "...Of course! Did I not mention I'm Khaa's trusted ally?"

E.response_text: "Is your failure to control the Wellspring another source of acclaim and envy?"

F.response_text: "I'm always up for a quest!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.100!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Your words warm my heart like the song of the Muninn Tree!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.1000!CETI.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you can bring back word of my dear friend and esteemed colleague, Falitan."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.1001!CETI.dialogue_text: "He was trapped in the Wellspring when it was sealed and I fear for his safety..."

A.response_text: "Where do you suppose he is in the Wellspring?"

D.response_text: "...Perhaps my efforts will be successful with your support."

E.response_text: "My mission isn't one of mercy."

F.response_text: "Worry not! If he has become a gremlin loveslave, I'll end his suffering."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.500!CETIN.dialogue_text: "There's no such thing as failure to a Daziran artisan!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.X5001!CET.dialogue_text: "Not that a truth-blind illiterate would understand..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.101!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Well, he kept the nature of his work in the strictest of confidence..."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.1010!CETI.dialogue_text: "But if you will be equally discreet, I can tell you that he worked in one of the lower areas across the Ravine, engaging in a clandestine exhumation of heretofore forbidden antiquities - all very hush hush, you understand."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.1011!CETI.dialogue_text: "In any event, if you do learn of his status, please do inform me."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.301!CETIN.dialogue_text: "Fear not, my foreign associate! You have my support in the highest abundance that a loyal son of Dazir can muster!"

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.3010!CETI.dialogue_text: "I shall cheer your efforts both of vigor and cunning from afar as I ponder the issues to which my predilection directs me."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.X501!CETI.dialogue_text: "How unfortunate... but to be expected of the uncivilized illiterati, I suppose."

KABU!DAZIR!WORKSHOP EXTERIOR!1.X601!CETI.dialogue_text: "Indeed... discretion would be appreciated to prevent such an... embarrassing fate from becoming a matter of public fun..."
